author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: I never saw a pessimistic general win a battle.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: Plans are worthless, but planning is everything.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: I would rather try to persuade a man to go along, because once I have persuaded him, he will stick. If I scare him, he will stay just as long as he is scared, and then he is gone.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: Sweet praise is like perfume. It is fine if you don't swallow it.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: No easy problem ever comes to the President of the United States. If they are easy to solve, somebody else had solved them.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: An intellectual is a man who takes more words than necessary to tell more than he knows.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: If you want total security, go to prison.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: The sergeant is the army.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: Don't think you are going to conceal faults by concealing evidence that they ever existed.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quoteText: What you cannot see in this world is far more powerful than anything you can see.
author: T. Harv Eker

quoteText: Critical Race Theory means those who do not consider America "systemically racist" can be theoretically criticized as racist.
author: Larry Elder

quoteText: Doing what you want to do is easy. Doing what you have to do is hard.
author: Larry Elder

quoteText: Most people work for the private sector, which cannot exist without profit.
author: Larry Elder

quoteText: White condescension says to a black child, "The rules used by other ethnic groups don't apply to you. Forget about work hard, get an education, possess good values. No, for you, we'll alter the rules by lowering the standards and expecting less." Expect less, get less.
author: Larry Elder

quoteText: I wrote a column this week in which I refer to Thomas Sowell about the fact that he was once on the left. And when I asked him what changed him, he said "evidence."
author: Larry Elder

quoteText: The number one problem facing this country is the absence of involved, responsible fathers.
author: Larry Elder

quoteText: If I'd known I was going to live to so long, I'd have taken better care of myself.
author: Leon Eldred

quoteText: A man is most accurately judged by how he treats those who are not in a position either to retaliate or to reciprocate.
author: Paul Eldridge

quoteText: In the spider-web of facts, many a truth is strangled.
author: Paul Eldridge

quoteText: There are those whose sole claim to profundity is the discovery of exceptions to the rules.
author: Paul Eldridge

quoteText: All business proceeds on beliefs, or judgments of probabilities, and not on certainties.
author: Charles W. Eliot

quoteText: Half of the harm that is done in this world is due to people who want to feel important.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: If you aren't in over your head, how do you know how tall you are?
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Life you may evade, but death you shall not.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: You will find that you survive humiliation. And that's an experience of incalculable value.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: All cases are unique and very similar to others.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Humility is the most difficult of all virtues to achieve; nothing dies harder than the desire to think well of oneself.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: In the last few years everything I'd done up to sixty or so has seemed very childish.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Men live by forgetting; women live on memories.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: The years between fifty and seventy are the hardest. You are always asked to do things, and you are not yet decrepit enough to turn them down.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: The young feel tired at the end of an action; The old at the beginning.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Success is relative. It is what we can make of the mess we have made of things.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Television is a medium of entertainment which permits millions of people to listen to the same joke at the same time, and yet remain lonesome.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: This is the way the world ends. Not with a bang but a whimper.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Humankind cannot bear very much reality.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: People to whom nothing has ever happened cannot understand the unimportance of events.
author: T. S. Eliot

quoteText: Grief is the price we pay for love.
author: Elizabeth II

quoteText: There has never been a statue erected to the memory of someone who let well enough alone.
author: Jules Ellinger

quoteText: Gray skies are just clouds passing over.
author: Duke Ellington

quoteText: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: Duke Ellington

quoteText: I don't need time. What I need is a deadline.
author: Duke Ellington

quoteText: There's only one wrong way to live and that's unhappily.
author: Patrick Elliott

quoteText: Whenever you avoid alarming situations . . . you almost always increase your anxiety about them.
author: Albert Ellis

quoteText: There is no reciprocity. Men love women, women love children, children love hamsters
author: Alice Thomas Ellis

quoteText: Pain and death are part of life. To reject them is to reject life itself.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: To live remains an art which everyone must learn, and which no one can teach.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: It is only the great men who are truly obscene. If they had not dared to be obscene, they could never have dared to be great.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: Civilized men arrived in the Pacific armed with alcohol, syphilis, trousers, and the Bible.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: What we call progress is the exchange of one nuisance for another.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: Men who know themselves are no longer fools.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: The by-product is sometimes more valuable than the product.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: The greatest task before civilization at present is to make machines what they ought to be, the slaves, instead of the masters of men.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: Imagination is a poor substitute for experience.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: Charm is a woman's strength just as strength is a man's charm.
author: Havelock Ellis

quoteText: If you believe that your thoughts originate inside your brain, do you also believe that television shows are made inside your television set?
author: Warren Ellis

quoteText: I don't mind you thinking I'm stupid, but don't talk to me like I'm stupid.
author: Harlan Ellison

quoteText: You can't win without being completely different.
author: Larry Ellison

quoteText: When you innovate, you've got to be prepared for everyone telling you you're nuts.
author: Larry Ellison

quoteText: When everyone else says we are crazy, I say, gee we must really be on to something.
author: Larry Ellison

quoteText: Play the game, but don't believe in it.
author: Ralph Ellison

quoteText: For an American to be patriotic is to be loyal to the principles of our Constitution, and the First Amendment. The truth is that the policies of the government is sometimes in conflict with that. In our country, patriotism should not be defined as obedience to an authority.
author: Dan Ellsberg

quoteText: When you come in late for work, everybody notices; when you work late, nobody notices.
author: Raymond F. Elsner

quoteText: If you don't like something, change it; if you can't change it, change the way you think about it.
author: Mary Engelbreit

quoteText: The big cities of America are becoming Third World Countries.
author: Nora Ephron

quoteText: If pregnancy were a book, they would cut the last two chapters.
author: Nora Ephron

quoteText: Could I turn back the time machine, I would double the attention I gave my children and go to fewer meetings.
author: J. D. Eppinga

quoteText: We will all be better citizens when voting records of our congressmen are followed as carefully as scores of pro football games.
author: Lou Erickson

quoteText: Gardening requires lots of water - most of it in the form of perspiration.
author: Lou Erickson

quoteText: Life is like a taxi. The meter just keeps a-ticking whether you are getting somewhere or just standing still.
author: Lou Erickson

quoteText: The most deadly of all possible sins is the mutilation of a child's spirit.
author: Erik Erikson

quoteText: Lots of old people don't become wise, but you don't get wise unless you age.
author: Joan Erikson

quoteText: The greatest barrier to success is the fear of failure.
author: Sven-Göran Eriksson

quoteText: Man's fear of ideas is probably the greatest dike holding back human knowledge and happiness.
author: Morris L. Ernst

quoteText: Most people have some sort of religion - at least they know what church they're staying away from.
author: John Erskine

quoteText: There is a difference between beauty and charm. A beautiful woman is one I notice. A charming woman is one who notices me.
author: John Erskine

quoteText: Millions long for immortality who do not know what to do with themselves on a rainy Sunday afternoon.
author: Susan Ertz

quoteText: Housework is what a woman does that nobody notices unless she hasn't done it.
author: Evan Esar

quoteText: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy - and Jill a rich widow
author: Evan Esar

quoteText: Statistics: The science of producing unreliable fact from reliable figures.
author: Evan Esar

quoteText: A computer will not make a good manager out of a bad manager. It makes a good manager better faster and a bad manager worse faster.
author: Edward M. Esber

quoteText: Only those who attempt the absurd will achieve the impossible.
author: M. C. Escher

quoteText: I am too old and stiff-necked to change my memories now.
author: Willard R. Espy

quoteText: If a child can't learn the way we teach, maybe we should teach the way they learn.
author: Ignacio Estrada

quoteText: Everything looks impossible for the people who never try anything.
author: Jean-Louis Etienne

quoteText: When a woman behaves like a man, why doesn't she behave like a nice man?
author: Edith Evans

quoteText: In journalism it is simpler to sound off than it is to find out. It is more elegant to pontificate than it is to sweat.
author: Harold Evans

quoteText: It doesn't matter how much game you think you have, no nightclub bartender wants to talk to you.
author: Sean Evans

quoteText: Children will not remember you for the material things you provided but for the feeling that you cherished them.
author: Richard L. Evans

quoteText: No man can ever enter Heaven until he is first convinced he deserves Hell.
author: John W. Everett

quoteText: Any time the country is split fifty-fifty, the leader is wrong.
author: Charles Evers

quoteText: Welfare makes you dependent upon someone to take care of you.
author: Charles Evers

quoteText: You can kill a man but you can't kill an idea.
author: Medgar Evers

quoteText: It will be gone before you know it. The fingerprints on the wall appear higher and higher. Then suddenly they disappear.
author: Dorothy Evslin

quoteText: It is the person who has done nothing is sure nothing can be done.
author: Patrick Ewing

quoteText: A boss creates fear, a leader confidence. A boss fixes blame, a leader corrects mistakes. A boss knows all, a leader asks questions. A boss makes work drudgery, a leader makes it interesting. A boss is interested in himself or herself, a leader is interested in the group.
author: Russell H. Ewing

quoteText: It's not the hours you put in your work that counts, it's the work you put in the hours.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: Your best friends are those who speak well of you behind your back.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: Inflation is when you pay fifteen dollars for the ten-dollar haircut you used to get for five dollars when you had hair.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: Nothing is so embarrassing as watching someone do something that you said couldn't be done.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: Parents who wonder where the younger generation is going should remember where it came from.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: Some people are much like blisters - they don't show up until the work is done.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: We are all born into the world with nothing. Everything we acquire after that is profit.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: President Herbert Hoover returned his salary to the government. His idea caught on and now we're all doing it.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: Vacation: Two weeks on the sunny sands - and the rest of the year on the financial rocks.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: As a child, a library card takes you to exotic, faraway places. When you're grown up, a credit card does it.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: When you finally go back to your old hometown, you find it wasn't the old home you missed but your childhood.
author: Sam Ewing

quoteText: Those proud of keeping an orderly desk never know the thrill of finding something they thought they had irretrievably lost.
author: Helen Exley

quoteText: Social justice isn't justice. It is the avenue where personal issues are turned into communal grievances for selfish motives.
author: Nick Fad

quoteText: We would be 1,500 years ahead if it hadn't been for the church dragging science back by its coattails and burning our best minds at the stake.
author: Catherine Fahringer

quoteText: My children . . . have been a constant joy to me (except on the days when they weren't).
author: Evelyn Fairbanks

quoteText: I have an 18-year-old; her name is Alexis.  I chose that name because if I hadn't had her, I'd be driving one.
author: Robin Fairbanks

quoteText: No amount of artificial reinforcement can offset the natural inequalities of human individuals.
author: Henry P. Fairchild

quoteText: So often people are working hard at the wrong thing. Working on the right thing is probably more important than working hard.
author: Caterina Fake

quoteText: Any child can tell you that the sole purpose of a middle name is so he can tell when he's really in trouble.
author: Dennis Fakes

quoteText: Don't keep reaching for the stars because you'll just look like an idiot stretching that way for no reason.
author: Jimmy Fallon

quoteText: A new survey found that 55 percent of men expect to pay on the first date. While the other 45 percent have never been on a second date.
author: Jimmy Fallon

quoteText: Always write angry letters to your enemies. Never mail them.
author: James Fallows

quoteText: If your wife doesn't treat you as she should, be thankful.
author: Jerry Falwell

quoteText: Traitors and those who have sold out to the enemy will be judged and punished .
author: Frantz Fanon

quoteText: Crime expands according to our willingness to put up with it.
author: Barry J. Farber

quoteText: We need people who push boundaries rather than retreat inside them.
author: Tim Fargo

quoteText: In the land of the skunks he who has half a nose is king.
author: Chris Farley

quoteText: The decision to do that extra bit must be embedded in the company's culture.
author: Tom Farmer

quoteText: If you want to be a leader with a large following, just obey the speed limit on a winding, two-lane road.
author: Charles Farr

quoteText: A difference, to be a difference, must make a difference.
author: James N. Farr

quoteText: People create problems by not trusting their own judgment. By creating a committee.
author: Pat Farrah

quoteText: When women hold off from marrying men, we call it independence. When men hold off from marrying women, we call it fear of commitment.
author: Warren Farrell

quoteText: Visitors should behave in such a way that the host and hostess feel at home.
author: J. S. Farynski

quoteText: In the last resort nothing is ridiculous except the fear of being so.
author: Henri Fauconnier

quoteText: When I come home from work and see those little noses pressed against the windowpane, then I know I am a success.
author: Paul Faulkner

quoteText: We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.
author: William Faulkner

quoteText: The artist doesn't have time to listen to the critics. The ones who want to be writers read the reviews, the ones who want to write don't have time to read reviews.
author: William Faulkner

quoteText: No man can cause more grief than that one clinging blindly to the vices of his ancestors.
author: William Faulkner

quoteText: A mule will labor ten years willingly and patiently for you, for the privilege of kicking you once.
author: William Faulkner

quoteText: For any action whatsoever, an employee should receive orders from one superior only.
author: Henri Fayol

quoteText: There is no merit in sowing dissension among subordinates; any beginner can do it.
author: Henri Fayol

quoteText: The dog barks but the caravan passes on.
author: Mohamed al-Fayed

quoteText: Anybody who claims he thoroughly understands God is somebody to beware of.
author: Dick Feagler

quoteText: The philosophy behind much advertising is based on the old observation that every man is really two men - the man he is and the man he wants to be.
author: William Feather

quoteText: A budget tells us what we can't afford, but it doesn't keep us from buying it.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Conditions are never just right. People who delay action until all factors are favorable do nothing.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Some people are making such thorough preparation for rainy days that they aren't enjoying today's sunshine.
author: William Feather

quoteText: If you can't say no, you can't expect to live within your income.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Unless a man has been kicked around a little, you can't really depend upon him to amount to anything.
author: William Feather

quoteText: The petty economies of the rich are just as amazing as the silly extravagances of the poor.
author: William Feather

quoteText: The way to get ahead is to start now.
author: William Feather

quoteText: The hardest job of all is trying to look busy when you're not.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Plenty of people miss their share of happiness, not because they never found it, but because they didn't stop to enjoy it.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Some of us might find happiness if we quit struggling so desperately for it.
author: William Feather

quoteText: One of the indictments of civilizations is that happiness and intelligence are so rarely found in the same person.
author: William Feather

quoteText: An idea isn't worth much until a man is found who has the energy and ability to make it work.
author: William Feather

quoteText: When ordering lunch, the big executives are just as indecisive as the rest of us.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Indifference and inaction must always pay a penalty.
author: William Feather

quoteText: The happiest people are those who are too busy to notice whether they are or not.
author: William Feather

quoteText: One of the funny things about the stock market is that every time one person buys, another sells, and both think they are astute.
author: William Feather

quoteText: If you're naturally kind, you attract a lot of people you don't like.
author: William Feather

quoteText: No man is a failure who is enjoying life.
author: William Feather

quoteText: If you don't take it for granted that the other man will do his job, you're not an executive.
author: William Feather

quoteText: A man of fifty looks as old as Santa Claus to a girl of twenty.
author: William Feather

quoteText: One of the many things nobody ever tells you about middle age is that it's such a nice change from being young.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Opportunities are seldom labeled.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Setting a good example for your children takes all the fun out of middle age.
author: William Feather

quoteText: The kindness lavished on dogs, if evenly distributed, would establish peace on earth.
author: William Feather

quoteText: It's often a good idea to let the other fellow believe he is running things whether he is or not.
author: William Feather

quoteText: We always admire the other fellow more after we have tried his job.
author: William Feather

quoteText: If we don't discipline ourselves the world will do it for us.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Success seems to be largely a matter of hanging on after others have let go.
author: William Feather

quoteText: If people really liked to work, we'd still be plowing the land with sticks and transporting goods on our backs.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Few women are dumb enough to listen to reason.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Women lie about their age; men lie about their income.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Work is the best method devised for killing time.
author: William Feather

quoteText: Business is always interfering with pleasure - but it makes other pleasures possible.
author: William Feather

quoteText: To equate the lives of killers with those of victims is the worst kind of moral equivalency. If capital punishment is state murder, then imprisonment is state kidnapping and restitution is state theft.
author: Don Feder

quoteText: People love others not for who they are but for how they make them feel.
author: Irwin Federman

quoteText: Your job gives you authority. Your behavior earns you respect.
author: Irwin Federman

quoteText: To the self-serving white leftist enablers of the Black Lives Matter movement . . . where's your condemnation of the riots? Where are your calls for peace? Where's your support of the police trying to further prevent the destruction of our communities?
author: Damani Felder

quoteText: Leftists secretly love watching rioting thugs destroy black communities. Because that means the minorities will need them for "help" again soon. Liberal dependency is modern day slavery.
author: Damani Felder

quoteText: Why do Democrats want illegals to come to the "racist" country they hate so much?
author: Damani Felder

quoteText: If the entertainment industry stopped glorifying and idolizing black thugs, maybe black children would quit growing up wanting to act just like them.
author: Damani Felder

quoteText: White liberals care more about black criminals than productive black members of society.
author: Damani Felder

quoteText: Imagine going along with everything the establishment says and thinking you're part of the resistance.
author: Damani Felder

quoteText: When I do things without any explanation, but just with spontaneity . . . I can be sure that I am right.
author: Federico Fellini

quoteText: Computer science is not about machines, in the same way that astronomy is not about telescopes.
author: Michael R. Fellows

quoteText: Perhaps too much of everything is as bad as too little.
author: Edna Ferber

quoteText: If English was good enough for Jesus Christ, it ought to be good enough for us.
author: Miriam "Ma" Ferguson

quoteText: If you cannot get your lawyer to call you, try not paying his bill.
author: Pete Ferguson

quoteText: A man is getting old when he walks around a puddle instead of through it.
author: R. C. Ferguson

quoteText: Smoking means always having to say you're sorry.
author: Tom Ferguson

quoteText: Some leaders are born women.
author: Geraldine Ferraro

quoteText: It was not so very long ago that people thought that semiconductors were part-time orchestra leaders and microchips were very small snack foods.
author: Geraldine Ferraro

quoteText: Courage is measured by fear that it overcomes.
author: Jacques Ferron

quoteText: The best way to put more money in people's wallets is to leave it there in the first place.
author: Edwin Feulner

quoteText: A man finds out what is meant by a spitting image when he tries to feed cereal to his infant.
author: Imogene Fey

quoteText: I would rather have questions that can't be answered than answers that can't be questioned.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quoteText: Science is like sex: sometimes something useful comes out, but that is not the reason we are doing it.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quoteText: I learned very early the difference between knowing the name of something and knowing something.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quoteText: Science is the belief in the ignorance of the experts.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quoteText: Have no respect whatsoever for authority; forget who said it and instead look at what he starts with, where he ends up, and ask yourself, "Is it reasonable?"
author: Richard P. Feynman

quoteText: It doesn't matter how beautiful your theory is, it doesn't matter how smart you are. If it doesn't agree with experiment, it's wrong.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quoteText: The truth always turns out to be simpler than you thought.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quoteText: Religion isn't the cause of wars, it's the excuse.
author: Jasper Fforde

quoteText: If life begins at 40, what is it that ends at 39?
author: Jim Fiebig

quoteText: If life were just, we would be born old and achieve youth about the time we'd saved enough to enjoy it.
author: Jim Fiebig

quoteText: When someone demands blind obedience, you'd be a fool not to peek.
author: Jim Fiebig

quoteText: If you can look back on your life with contentment, you have one of man's most precious gifts - a selective memory.
author: Jim Fiebig

quoteText: The hand that rocks the cradle usually is attached to someone who isn't getting enough sleep.
author: John Fiebig

quoteText: The great dividing line between success and failure can be expressed in five words: "I did not have time."
author: Franklin Field

quoteText: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
author: Joanna Field

quoteText: I've been on a diet for two weeks and all I've lost is fourteen days.
author: Totie Fields

quoteText: Always carry a flagon of whiskey in case of snakebite and furthermore always carry a small snake.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: The best thing for a case of nerves is a case of Scotch.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: When doctors and undertakers meet, they wink at each other.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: I never worry about being driven to drink; I just worry about being driven home.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: A man's got to believe in something. I believe I'll have another drink.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: Horse sense is the thing a horse has which keeps it from betting on people.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: Don't worry about your heart. It will last as long as you live.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: The world is getting to be such a dangerous place, a man is lucky to get out of it alive.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: The best cure for insomnia is to get a lot of sleep.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: Hell, I never vote for anybody, I always vote against.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: If at first you don't succeed, try, try again. Then quit. There's no use being a damn fool about it.
author: W.C. Fields

quoteText: Insomnia: A contagious disease often transmitted from babies to parents.
author: Shannon Fife

quoteText: The persons hardest to convince that they're at the retirement age are children at bedtime.
author: Shannon Fife

quoteText: Why shouldn't the American people take half my money from me?  I took all of it from them.
author: Edward A. Filene

quoteText: He can inspire a group only if he himself is filled with confidence and hope for success.
author: Floyd V. Filson

quoteText: People are more easily led than driven.
author: David Harold Fink

quoteText: Keep your promises to yourself.
author: David Harold Fink

quoteText: Maturity is the capacity to endure uncertainty.
author: John Huston Finley

quoteText: You get the best out of others when you give the best of yourself.
author: Harvey S. Firestone

quoteText: It is only as we develop others that we permanently succeed.
author: Harvey S. Firestone

quoteText: If obedience invariably leads to cruelty, disobedience is our moral duty.
author: Martin Firrell

quoteText: A historian who swears to tell nothing but the whole truth, would thereby take a vow of eternal silence. (1970)
author: David Hackett Fischer

quoteText: A conclusion is the place where you got tired thinking.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Life preys upon life. This is biology's most fundamental fact.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Facts are not science, as the dictionary is not literature.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Education is the process of driving a set of prejudices down your throat.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: The specialist is a man who fears the other subjects.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Diagnosis is not the end, but the beginning of practice.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Whenever ideas fail, men invent words.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Knowledge is a process of piling up facts; wisdom lies in their simplification.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Take a man out of the trenches, make him a straw boss, and he develops a belly.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Lots of things work in practice for which the laboratory has never found proof.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quoteText: Like most men, I'm a life support system for a phallus.
author: Tibor Fischer

quoteText: As you get older, the pickings get slimmer, but the people don't.
author: Carrie Fisher

quoteText: A mother is not a person to lean on but a person to make leaning unnecessary.
author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher

quoteText: When you aim for perfection, you discover it's a moving target.
author: Geoffrey F. Fisher

quoteText: Evangelicals often preach that what the culture needs is absolute truth, but what the culture needs is a church that believes the truth so absolutely it actually lives it out.
author: David Fitch

quoteText: No grand idea was ever born in a conference, but a lot of foolish ideas have died there.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quoteText: One should . . . be able to see things as hopeless and yet be determined to make them otherwise.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quoteText: Vitality shows not only in the ability to persist, but in the ability to start over.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quoteText: If you're strong enough, there are no precedents.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quoteText: Nothing is as obnoxious as other people's luck.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quoteText: The cleverly expressed opposite of any generally accepted idea is worth a fortune to somebody.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quoteText: Those who are lifting the world upward and onward are those who encourage more than criticize.

quoteText: As long as you hate, there will be people to hate.

quoteText: The waste of money cures itself, for soon there is no more to waste.

quoteText: The past is foreign country: they do things differently there.

quoteText: Doubt is at the very basis of knowledge, since it is the essential condition for the search for truth.

quoteText: Those who tell you it's tough at the top have never been at the bottom.

quoteText: The difference between faith and insanity is that faith is the ability to hold firmly to a conclusion that is incompatible with the evidence, whereas insanity is the ability to hold firmly to a conclusion that is incompatible with the evidence.

quoteText: The man who is too old to learn was probably always too old.
author: Dr. Caryl P. Haskins

quoteText: Save a little money each month and at the end of the year you'll be surprised at how little you have.

quoteText: Do not offer advice which has not been seasoned by your own performance.

quoteText: Discontent follows ambition like a shadow.

quoteText: An impossibility does not disturb us until its accomplishment shows what fools we were.

quoteText: The man who is too old to learn was probably always too old to learn.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quoteText: Disappointments should be cremated not embalmed.

quoteText: The time to stop talking is when the other person nods his head affirmatively but says nothing.

quoteText: Truth would become more popular if it were not always stating ugly facts.

quoteText: The greatest masterpieces were once only pigments on a palette.

quoteText: Parents pushing back against CRT is not a political thing, it's a "love your children" thing.

quoteText: It is not a persuasive argument that an evil should continue because it has existed in the past

quoteText: Sooner or later, we must realize there is no station, no one place to arrive at once and for all.  The true joy of life is the trip.

quoteText: The best kind of sex education is life in a loving family.

quoteText: A woman can say more in a sigh than a man can say in a sermon.

quoteText: I found that I did not (and probably never would) know enough about the true nature of the universe to tell anyone else what to believe, and I came to distrust the words of those who presumed to do so.

quoteText: It is not enough to stare up the steps; we must step up the stairs.
author: Václav Havel

quoteText: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
author: Stephen Hawking

quoteText: Even people who claim everything is predestined . . . look before they cross the road.
author: Stephen Hawking

quoteText: I am discounting reports of UFOs.  Why would they appear only to cranks and weirdos?
author: Stephen Hawking

quoteText: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
author: Stephen Hawking

quoteText: Life is a lottery that we've already won. But most people have not cashed in their tickets.
author: Louise L. Hay

quoteText: I'm going to speak my mind because I have nothing to lose.
author: S. I. Hayakawa

quoteText: A bias recognized is a bias sterilized.
author: A. Eustace Haydon

quoteText: The pursuit of profit is the only way . . . people can meet the needs of those they don't know.
author: Friedrich von Hayek

quoteText: A claim for equality of material position can be met only by a government with totalitarian powers.

quoteText: There is all the difference in the world between treating people equal and attempting to make them equal.

quoteText: We shall not grow wiser before we learn that much that we have done was very foolish.
author: Friedrich von Hayek

quoteText: If socialists understood economics they wouldn't be socialists.

quoteText: Social justice rests on the hate towards those that enjoy a comfortable position, namely, upon envy.

quoteText: I'm suspicious of people who talk about their feelings to the whole world.

quoteText: There is no way to make people like change.  You can only make them feel less threatened by it.
author: Frederick O'R. Hayes

quoteText: One has to grow up with good talk in order to form the habit of it.
author: Helen Hayes

quoteText: Capital punishment: The income tax.
author: Jeff Hayes

quoteText: If we are going to teach creation science as an alternative to evolution, then we should also teach the stork theory as an alternative to biological reproduction.

quoteText: Back of every achievement is a proud wife and a surprised mother-in-law.
author: Brooks Hays

quoteText: The boss' brains are under the cap of the working man.

author: Bill Haywood

quoteText: The only real cure for poverty is production.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quoteText: There are millions receiving government payments who have come to consider them as an earned right, who of course find them inadequate, and who are outraged at the slightest suggestion of a critical re-examination of the subject.

quoteText: There can be little doubt that many egalitarians are motivated at least partially by envy.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quoteText: The essential function of the State is to maintain peace, justice, law, and order, and to protect the individual citizen against aggression, violence, theft, and fraud.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quoteText: The whole gospel of Karl Marx can be summed up in a single sentence: Hate the man who is better off than you are. Never under any circumstances admit that his success may be due to his own efforts.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quoteText: Government relief . . . tends to reduce the incentives to work and to save, both of those who receive it and of those who are forced to pay it.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quoteText: Your dresses should be tight enough to show you're a woman and loose enough to show you're a lady.
author: Edith Head

quoteText: If you find yourself in a hole, stop digging.
author: Denis Healey

quoteText: You must keep your mind on the objective, not on the obstacle.
author: William Randolph Hearst

quoteText: The only time some people work like a horse is when the boss rides them.
author: Gabriel Heatter

quoteText: A man who struts in my presence hopes to find in my eyes an importance missing in his own.
author: Ben Hecht

quoteText: Babies don't need fathers, but mothers do.
author: Amy Heckerling

quoteText: When someone hands you a flier, it's like they're saying "here, you throw this away."

quoteText: Every book is a children's book if the kid can read!
author: Mitch Hedberg

quoteText: Fettuccine alfredo is macaroni and cheese for adults.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quoteText: The depressing thing about tennis is that no matter how good I get, I'll never be as good as a wall.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quoteText: A society without the means to detect lies and theft soon squanders its liberty and freedom.
author: Chris Hedges

quoteText: If you're poor and you do something stupid, you're nuts.  If you're rich and do something stupid, you're eccentric.
author: Bobby Heenan

quoteText: The leader who tries to control the group through force does not understand group process.  Force will cost you the support of the members.

quoteText: Good leadership consists of motivating people to their highest levels by offering them opportunities, not obligations.
author: John Heider

quoteText: No matter what side of the argument you are on, you always find people on your side that you wish were on the other.

quoteText: There is no top. There are always further heights to reach.
author: Jascha Heifetz

quoteText: Less than seventy-five years after it officially began, the contest between capitalism and socialism is over: capitalism has won.
author: Robert Heilbroner

quoteText: Ideas move fast when their time comes.

quoteText: Ironically, women who acquire power are more likely to be criticized for it than are the men who have always had it.
author: Carolyn Heilbrun

quoteText: There is little room left for wisdom when one is full of judgment.

quoteText: Since when was an emotional argument won by logic.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: In a family argument, if it turns out you are right, apologize at once.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Autobiography is usually honest but it is never truthful.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: One of the sanest, surest, and most generous joys of life comes from being happy over the good fortune of others
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: A society that gets rid of all its troublemakers goes downhill.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: No statement should be believed because it is made by an authority.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: A critic is a man who creates nothing and thereby feels qualified to judge the work of creative men.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: I don't see how an article of clothing can be indecent. A person, yes.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Each generation thinks it invented sex
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: The supreme irony of life is that hardly anyone gets out of it alive.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Live and learn, or you don't live long.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Ninety percent of all human wisdom is the ability to mind your own business.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Everything is theoretically impossible, until it is done.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Being right too soon is socially unacceptable.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Progress is made by lazy men looking for easier ways to do things
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Never appeal to a man's "better nature."  He might not have one.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: I never learned from a man who agreed with me.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: A pessimist is correct oftener than an optimist, but an optimist has more fun, and neither can stop the march of events.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Don't handicap your children by making their lives easy.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Man is not a rational animal, he is a rationalizing animal.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: The capacity of the human mind for swallowing nonsense and spewing it forth in violent and repressive action has never yet been plumbed.

quoteText: In the absence of clearly-defined goals, we become loyal to performing daily trivia until we become enslaved by it.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: One person's theology is another person's belly laugh.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: The less respect an older person deserves the more certain he is to demand it from anyone younger.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Sin lies only in hurting others unnecessarily.  All other sins are invented nonsense.

quoteText: Never worry about theory as long as the machinery does what it's supposed to do.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Secrecy is the beginning of tyranny.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Women and cats will do as they please.  Men and dogs had better get used to it.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quoteText: Don't forget to swing hard, in case you hit the ball.
author: Woodie Held

quoteText: He was a self-made man who owed his lack of success to nobody.
author: Joseph Heller

quoteText: I have something no billionaire will ever have: enough.

quoteText: Every writer I know has trouble writing.
author: Joseph Heller

quoteText: Never ignore a gut feeling: but never believe that it's enough on its own.

quoteText: The first myth of management is that it exists.
author: Robert Heller

quoteText: Managers are to information as alcoholics are to booze. They consume enormous amounts, constantly crave more, but have great difficulty in digesting their existing intake.

quoteText: It is a mark of many famous people that they cannot part with their finest hour.
author: Lillian Hellman

quoteText: Since when do we have to agree with people to defend them from injustice?
author: Lillian Hellman

quoteText: I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions.
author: Lillian Hellman

quoteText: Nobody outside of a baby carriage or a judge's chamber believes in an unprejudiced point of view.
author: Lillian Hellman

quoteText: Lonely people, in talking to each other, can make each other lonelier.
author: Lillian Hellman

quoteText: It is best to act with confidence, no matter how little right you have to it.
author: Lillian Hellman

quoteText: Nothing on paper; paper can be lost or stolen or simply inherited by the wrong people; if you want to keep something secret, don't write it down.
author: Richard Helms

quoteText: Well-timed silence is the most commanding expression.
author: Mark Helprin

quoteText: The man who believes he can do it is probably right, and so is the man who believes he can't.
author: Claude Adrien Helvetius

quoteText: The world breaks everyone and afterward many are strong in the broken places.

quoteText: As you get older it is harder to have heroes, but it is sort of necessary.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quoteText: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk.  That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quoteText: Critics are men who watch a battle from a high place, then come down and shoot the survivors.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quoteText: The great fallacy: the wisdom of old men.  They do not grow wise.  They grow careful.

quoteText: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.

quoteText: When people talk, listen completely.  Don't be thinking what you're going to say.  Most people never listen.  Nor do they observe.

quoteText: The first and final thing you have to do in this world is to last in it.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quoteText: Nobody knows what's in him until he tries to pull it out.  If there's nothing, or very little, the shock can kill a man.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quoteText: I know only that what is moral is what you feel good after and what is immoral is what you feel bad after.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quoteText: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quoteText: Next to the writer of real estate advertisements, the autobiographer is the most suspect of prose artists.
author: Donal Henahan

quoteText: Fathers send their sons to college either because they went to college or because they didn't.
author: L. L. Henderson

quoteText: The true meaning of life is to plant trees, under whose shade you do not expect to sit.

quoteText: I am grateful I somehow learned to value self-discovery over blind obedience to authority. The Buddha himself said we shouldn't believe his words without question-we must discover the truth for ourselves.

quoteText: If you have enough meetings over a long enough period of time, the meetings become more important than the problem the meetings were intended to solve.

quoteText: I don't give a damn what others say.  It's okay to color outside of the lines.

quoteText: Knowledge speaks but wisdom listens.

quoteText: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.

quoteText: A company's business would increase fifty percent if you cleared the conference room of chairs.
author: W. F. Heneghan

quoteText: The world never puts a price on you higher than the one you put on yourself.

quoteText: Ethics must begin at the top of an organization.  It is a leadership issue and the chief executive must set the example.

quoteText: Doctrines have this advantage: they dispense with having ideas.

quoteText: To do what others cannot do is talent.  To do what talent cannot do is genius.
author: Will Henry

quoteText: I don't want to be alone, I want to be left alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quoteText: It is the plain women who know about love; the beautiful women are too busy being fascinating.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quoteText: A sharp knife cuts the quickest and hurts the least.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quoteText: If you always do what interests you, at least one person is pleased.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quoteText: Life is hard.  After all, it kills you.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quoteText: If you want to sacrifice the admiration of many men for the criticism of one, go ahead, get married.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quoteText: If you're given a choice between money and sex appeal, take the money.  As you get older, the money will become your sex appeal.

quoteText: Trying to be fascinating is an asinine position to be in.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quoteText: Plain women know more about men than beautiful ones do.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quoteText: The conception of two people living together for twenty-five years without having a cross word suggests a lack of spirit only to be admired in sheep.

quoteText: Power attracts the corruptible.  Suspect all who seek it.
author: Frank Herbert

quoteText: The concept of progress acts as a protective mechanism to shield us from the terrors of the future.
author: Frank Herbert

quoteText: If you rely only on your eyes, your other senses weaken.
author: Frank Herbert

quoteText: English is a funny language.  A fat chance and a slim chance are the same thing.

quoteText: Modesty: the gentle art of enhancing your charm by pretending not to be aware of it.

quoteText: Many are called but few get up.
author: Oliver Herford

quoteText: Tact is to lie about others as you would have them lie about you.
author: Oliver Herford

quoteText: There is always room at the top - after the investigation.

quoteText: If some people got their rights, they would complain of being deprived of their wrongs.

quoteText: A woman's mind is cleaner than a man's; she changes it more often.
author: Oliver Herford

quoteText: The dawn is a term for the early morning used by poets and other people who don't have to get up.

quoteText: Be yourself.  No one can ever tell you you're doing it wrong.
author: James Leo Herlihy

quoteText: Socialists and progressives confuse compassion and compulsion.

quoteText: I have no idea what the mind of a lowlife scoundrel is like, but I know what the mind of an honest man is like; it is terrifying.

quoteText: Those who mistake their good luck for their merit are inevitably bound for disaster.
author: J. Christopher Herold

quoteText: Unhappiness is not knowing what we want and killing ourselves to get it.

quoteText: If I had my life to live over, I'd try to make more mistakes next time.

quoteText: Babies are such a nice way to start people.
author: Don Herold

quoteText: There's one thing about baldness - it's neat.

quoteText: There is nobody so irritating as somebody with less intelligence and more sense than we have.
author: Don Herold

quoteText: It takes a lot of things to prove you are smart, but only one thing to prove you are ignorant.

quoteText: Don't ever slam the door, you might want to go back.
author: Don Herold

quoteText: I do not believe in doing for pleasure things that I do not like to do.
author: Don Herold

quoteText: Women give us solace, but if it were not for women, we would never need solace.
author: Don Herold

quoteText: If I had my life to live over, I would perhaps have more actual troubles but I'd have fewer imaginary ones.

quoteText: Creativity always dies a quick death in rooms that house conference tables.

quoteText: Reprimand your child regularly every day.  You may not know why, but the kid does.
author: Harry Hershfield

quoteText: A boy becomes an adult three years before his parents think he does, and about two years after he thinks he does.
author: Lewis B. Hershey

quoteText: Give them quality.  That's the best kind of advertising.
author: Milton S. Hershey

quoteText: Nobody ever was frightened into being good.
author: Dr. Arthur E. Hertzler

quoteText: A reward once given becomes a right.
author: Frederick Herzberg

quoteText: If you want people motivated to do a good job, give them a good job to do.
author: Frederick Herzberg

quoteText: It is only when a person has his own generator that we can talk about motivation.

quoteText: True motivation comes from achievement, personal development, job satisfaction, and recognition.

quoteText: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: Theodore M. Hesburgh

quoteText: It is easier to exemplify values than teach them.
author: Theodore M. Hesburgh

quoteText: The most important thing that a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: Theodore M. Hesburgh

quoteText: All of us are experts at practicing virtue at a distance.
author: Theodore M. Hesburgh

quoteText: The very essence of leadership is that you have to have vision.  You can't blow an uncertain trumpet.
author: Theodore M. Hesburgh

quoteText: When I was young, I admired clever people.  Now that I am old, I admire kind people.
author: Abraham J. Heschel

quoteText: He who wields the knife never wears the crown.
author: Michael Heseltine

quoteText: Adults have already been taught to look at things only one way - the accepted way.  Eight-year-olds are too uneducated to be that dumb.
author: Karl Hess

quoteText: People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest.
author: Hermann Hesse

quoteText: Only the ideas that we actually live are of any value.
author: Hermann Hesse

quoteText: Knowledge can be communicated but not wisdom.
author: Hermann Hesse

quoteText: Some of us think holding on makes us strong; but sometimes it is letting go.
author: Hermann Hesse

quoteText: Political correctness is tyranny with manners.
author: Charlton Heston

quoteText: Justice should not only be done, but should manifestly and undoubtedly be seen to be done.
author: Gordon Hewart

quoteText: The art of negotiation is something you learn at an early age.  You'd be amazed how many teenagers get their first car by asking for a motorcycle.
author: James Hewett

quoteText: The gap in our economy is between what we have and what we think we ought to have - and that is a moral problem, not an economic one.
author: Paul T. Heyne

quoteText: Children are smarter than any of us . . . I don't know one child with a full-time job and children.
author: Bill Hicks

quoteText: You can devise a one-word argument to defeat the Bible: dinosaurs.
author: Bill Hicks

author: Bill Hicks

quoteText: Eternal suffering awaits anyone who questions God's infinite love.
author: Bill Hicks

quoteText: Worrying is using your imagination to create something you don't want.
author: Esther Hicks

quoteText: A censor is a man who knows more than he thinks you ought to.
author: Granville Hicks

quoteText: No man knows more about women than I do, and I know nothing.
author: Seymour Hicks

quoteText: We pursue that which retreats from us.
author: Martin Hiedegger

quoteText: Equality is about treating everyone equally, so they can succeed on their own merits.  Equity treats everyone differently to stifle the efforts of some.
author: David Higgins

quoteText: Egotism - the art of seeing in yourself what others cannot see.
author: George V. Higgins

quoteText: When you are presented with a choice between two evils, do not choose the lesser.  Choose the exit.
author: Robert Higgs

quoteText: Once a bureau is created, its staff becomes a tenacious political interest group, well placed to defend its budget and to make a case for expanding its activities.
author: Robert Higgs

quoteText: Saying what we think gives us a wider conversational range than saying what we know.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: It's hard to see a halo when you're looking for horns.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: Older generations are living proof that younger generations can survive their lunacy.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: Sometimes we deny being worthy of praise, hoping to generate an argument we would be pleased to lose.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: A true measure of your worth includes all the benefits others have gained from your success.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: People seldom become famous for what they say until after they are famous for what they've done.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: Talk is cheap - except when Congress does it.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: We may not imagine how our lives could be more frustrating and complex -- but Congress can.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: The only new ideas that are not subject to our skepticism or suspicion are our own.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: There's always somebody who is paid too much and taxed too little - and it's always somebody else.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: Every adult should be an expert on teenagers, after spending life's seven longest years being one.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: Wisdom is what's left after we've run out of personal opinions.
author: Cullen Hightower

quoteText: Very few people do anything creative after the age of thirty-five.  The reason is that very few people do anything creative before the age of thirty-five.
author: Joel Hildebrand

quoteText: Don't call the world dirty because you forgot to clean your glasses.
author: Aaron Hill

quoteText: Just because nobody complains doesn't mean all parachutes are perfect.
author: Benny Hill

quoteText: Have you noticed that all the people in favor of birth control are already born?
author: Benny Hill

quoteText: Unless freedom is universal it is only extended privilege.
author: Christopher Hill

quoteText: I am no longer going to become a fictional character to please people.  That's too much work.
author: Lauryn Hill

quoteText: Action is the real measure of intelligence.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: It is always your next move.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: No man can succeed in a line of endeavor which he does not like.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: If you must speak ill of another, do not speak it, write it in the sand near the water's edge.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: One of the main weaknesses of mankind is the average man's familiarity with the word "impossible."
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: Don't wait.  The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: The best job goes to the person who can get it done without passing the buck or coming back with excuses.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: You must get involved to have an impact.  No one is impressed with the won-lost record of the referee.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: The majority of men meet with failure because of their lack of persistence in creating new plans to take the place of those which fail.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: Indecision is the seedling of fear.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: The man who does more than he is paid for will soon be paid for more than he does.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: The world is filled with unfortunate souls who didn't hear opportunity's knock at the door because they were down at the convenience store buying lottery tickets.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: Your one big opportunity may be right where you are now.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: No one can make you jealous, angry, vengeful, or greedy, unless you let him.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: All great truths are simple in final analysis and easily understood; if they are not, they are not great truths.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: One of the most common causes of failure is the habit of quitting when one is overtaken by temporary defeat.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: No accurate thinker will judge another person by that which the other person's enemies say about him.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: Effort only fully releases its reward after a person refuses to quit.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: It is literally true that you can succeed best and quickest by helping others to succeed.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: We can do more good by being good than in any other way.
author: Rowland Hill

quoteText: The moment you have children yourself, you forgive your parents everything.
author: Susan Hill

quoteText: Nothing is more binding than the friendship of companions-in-arms.
author: George Stillman Hillard

quoteText: It is not the mountain we conquer but ourselves.
author: Edmund Hillary

quoteText: That fear of missing out on things makes you miss out on everything.
author: Etty Hillesum

quoteText: Show me a man who understands women, and I'll show you a man who is in for a big surprise.
author: Burton Hillis

quoteText: It's not the bulls and bears you need to avoid - it's the bum steers.
author: Chuck Hillis

quoteText: A whale is harpooned only when it spouts.
author: Henry Hillman

quoteText: Enthusiasm is a vital element toward the individual success of every man or woman.
author: Conrad Hilton

quoteText: No matter what a woman looks like, if she's confident, she's sexy.
author: Paris Hilton

quoteText: No one has ever made himself great by showing how small someone else is.
author: Irvin Himmel

quoteText: People want to know how much you care before they care how much you know.
author: James F. Hind

quoteText: If you hit every time, the target is too near or too big.
author: Tom Hirshfield

quoteText: There is no terror in a bang, only in the anticipation of it.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quoteText: The ideal husband understands every word his wife doesn't say.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quoteText: The length of a film should be directly related to the endurance of the human bladder.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quoteText: I'm very depressed how in this country you can be told 'That's offensive' as though those two words constitute an argument.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: Gullibility and credulity are considered undesirable qualities in every department of human life - except religion
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: Religion attacks us in our deepest integrity by saying we wouldn't be able to make a moral decision without it.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: Those who are determined to be "offended" will discover a provocation somewhere.  We cannot possibly adjust enough to please the fanatics, and it's degrading to make the attempt.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: What can be asserted without evidence can also be dismissed without evidence.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: The person who is certain, and who claims divine warrant for his certainty, belongs now to the infancy of our species.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: Religion comes from the period of human prehistory where nobody . . . had the smallest idea what was going on.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: Human decency is not derived from religion. It precedes it.
author: Christopher Hitchens

quoteText: A liberal will defend to the death your right to agree with her.  Disagree with her, and she will call the police.
author: Peter Hitchens

quoteText: The working class . . . is actually responsible for every gain that the world has.
author: Ron Hively

quoteText: Kindness means doing a lot of little things kindly and always; not just a big thing now and then.
author: Neville Hobson

quoteText: If you don't understand that you work for your mislabeled "subordinates," then you know nothing of leadership. You know only tyranny.
author: Dee Hock

quoteText: Make a careful list of all things done to you that you abhorred.  Don't do them to others, ever.
author: Dee Hock

quoteText: The problem is never how to get new, innovative thoughts into your mind, but how to get old ones out.
author: Dee Hock

quoteText: Every day is a gift - even if it sucks.
author: Sherry Hockman

quoteText: Life doesn't have clear edges.

quoteText: Faith must have adequate evidence, else it is mere superstition.

quoteText: Did anyone ever have a boring dream?

quoteText: Some things have to be believed to be seen.

quoteText: There would be no society if living together depending upon understanding each other.

quoteText: The past is a guidepost, not a hitching post

quoteText: An undefined problem has an infinite number of solutions.

quoteText: Goals are dreams with deadlines.

quoteText: A critic is a man who expects miracles.

quoteText: All children behave as well as they are treated.

quoteText: Alcohol is the liquid version of Photoshop.

quoteText: Inertia can develop its own momentum.

quoteText: If people don't want to come, nothing will stop them
author: Sol Hurok

quoteText: It takes a clever man to turn cynic and a wise man to be clever enough not to.

quoteText: Desperation, not necessity, is the Mother of invention.

quoteText: People always get what they ask for; the only trouble is that they never know, until they get it, what it actually is that they have asked for
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: The end cannot justify the means, for the simple and obvious reason that the means employed determine the nature of the ends produced.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.

quoteText: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life.  The only completely consistent people are dead.

quoteText: The surest way to work up a crusade in favor of some good cause is to promise people they will have a chance of maltreating someone.

quoteText: To his dog, every man is Napoleon; hence the constant popularity of dogs.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: That all men are equal is a proposition which at ordinary times no sane individual has ever given his assent.

quoteText: Several excuses are always less convincing than one.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Experience teaches only the teachable.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Experience is not what happens to a man, it is what a man does with what happens to him.

quoteText: Speed, it seems to me, provides the one genuinely modern pleasure.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: An unexciting truth may be eclipsed by a thrilling lie.

quoteText: A fanatic is a man who consciously overcompensates a secret doubt.

quoteText: Happiness is something you get as a by-product in the process of making something else.

quoteText: That men do not learn very much from the lessons of history is the most important of all the lessons of history.

quoteText: Most human beings have an absolute and infinite capacity for taking things for granted.

quoteText: Ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you mad.

quoteText: It's a little embarrassing that after forty-five years of research and study, the best advice I can give people is to be a little kinder to each other.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: I wanted to change the world, but I have found that the only thing one can be sure of changing is oneself.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: There's only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that's your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: The vast majority of human beings dislike and even actually dread all notions with which they are not familiar.

quoteText: Experience teaches only the teachable
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: So long as men worship the Caesars and Napoleons, Caesars and Napoleons will duly rise and make them miserable.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Idealism is the noble toga that political gentlemen drape over their will to power.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Every gain made by individuals or society is almost instantly taken for granted.

quoteText: The propagandist's purpose is to make one set of people forget that certain other sets of people are human.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Proverbs are always platitudes until you have personally experienced the truth of them.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: The vast majority of human beings are not interested in reason or satisfied with what it teaches.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Cynical realism is the intelligent man's best excuse for doing nothing in an intolerable situation.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Historians will look back on our time and those who are honest will detail this social media, clickbait era as a time of great deception. It's nothing but people spending money they don't have to create an image that's not real to gain validity from people they don't know.

quoteText: The vision of things to be done may come a long time before the way of doing them becomes clear, but woe to him who distrusts the vision.

quoteText: If you have tried to do something and failed, you are vastly better off than if you had tried nothing and succeeded.
author: Lloyd Jones

quoteText: Ours is the age that is proud of machines that think and suspicious of men who try to.
author: H. Mumford Jones

quoteText: Because criminals carry guns, we decent law-abiding citizens should also have guns.  Otherwise, they will win and the decent people will lose.
author: James Earl Jones

quoteText: I think of lotteries as a tax on the mathematically challenged.
author: Roger Jones

quoteText: You shouldn't step on people to get ahead, but you can step over them if they are in the way.
author: Star Jones

quoteText: Fame means that millions of people have the wrong idea of who you are.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: Gossip is the opiate of the oppressed.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: Jealousy is all the fun you think they had.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: It takes courage to lead a life. Any life.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: You see a lot of smart guys with dumb women, but you hardly ever see a smart woman with a dumb guy.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: Everyone has talent; what is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: Show me a woman who doesn't feel guilty and I'll show you a man.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: Take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing: no one to blame.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: Advice is what we ask for when we already know the answer but wish we didn't.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: There are no atheists on turbulent airplanes.
author: Erica Jong

quoteText: Don't compromise yourself. You're all you've got.
author: Janis Joplin

quoteText: If you're going to play the game properly, you'd better know every rule.
author: Barbara Jordan

quoteText: The world stands aside to let anyone pass who knows where he is going.

quoteText: Wisdom is knowing what to do next, skill is knowing how to do it, and virtue is doing it.
author: David Starr Jordan

quoteText: Straighten up your room first, then the world.
author: Jeff Jordan

quoteText: Freedom doesn't require the President's permission.
author: Rep. Jim Jordan

quoteText: I can accept failure. Everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying.

quoteText: I don't do things half-heartedly. Because I know if I do, then I can expect half-hearted results.
author: Michael Jordan

quoteText: You have to expect things of yourself before you can do them.

quoteText: The better people think they are, the better they will be. A positive self-image creates success.
author: Liisa Joronen

quoteText: If your outrage is selective, your outrage is invalid.
author: Deon Joseph

quoteText: A society of sheep must in time beget a government of wolves.
author: Bertrand de Jouvenel

quoteText: The real measure of our wealth is how much we'd be worth if we lost all our money.
author: J. H. Jowett

quoteText: Whatever else is unsure in this stinking dunghill of a world a mother's love is not.
author: James Joyce

quoteText: Mistakes are the portals of discovery.
author: James Joyce

quoteText: Big words . . . make us so unhappy.
author: James Joyce

quoteText: Most people are far more prone to let the bad experiences shape their views than the good ones.
author: Rick Joyner

quoteText: Condemnation does not liberate: it oppresses.

quoteText: The healthy man does not torture others - generally it is the tortured who turn into the torturers.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quoteText: Every form of addiction is bad, no matter whether the narcotic be alcohol or morphine or idealism.

quoteText: Man needs difficulties; they are necessary for health.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quoteText: Wherever an inferiority complex exists, there is a good reason for it. There is always something inferior there.

quoteText: If one does not understand a person, one tends to regard him as a fool.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quoteText: Children are educated by what the grown-up is and not by his talk.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quoteText: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.

quoteText: The world will ask you who you are, and if you don't know, the world will tell you.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quoteText: Nothing has a stronger influence psychologically on their environment and especially on their children than the unlived life of the parent.
author: Carl Gustav Jung

quoteText: The voices grow louder as understanding diminishes.
author: Friedrich Georg Junger

quoteText: Try and fail, but don't fail to try.
author: Stephen Kaggwa

quoteText: Procrastination is epidemic.  The number of people who finish projects three weeks ahead of time you can count on one hand.

quoteText: It's easier for people to see it your way if you first see it their way.

quoteText: I think life is sacred, whether it's abortion or the death penalty.

quoteText: The Great Wall of China is no longer a protection to anyone; it is a monument to the dead who built it!

quoteText: Nothing poses so many obligations to the individual as freedom.
author: Vjekoslav Kaleb

quoteText: Every religion should be in favor of humankind.
author: Santosh Kalwar

quoteText: Two can live as cheaply as one for half as long.
author: Howard Kandel

quoteText: The reason people become columnists is so they won't be interrupted.
author: Stefan Kanfer

quoteText: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
author: Garson Kanin

quoteText: Amateurs hope, professionals work.
author: Garson Kanin

quoteText: Leaders are more powerful role models when they learn than when they teach.
author: Rosabeth Moss Kanter

quoteText: By empowering others, a leader does not decrease his power, instead he may increase it - especially if the whole organization performs better.
author: Rosabeth Moss Kanter

quoteText: If security no longer comes automatically with being employed, then it must come from being employable.
author: Rosabeth Moss Kanter

quoteText: Give a small boy a hammer and he will find that everything he encounters needs pounding.
author: Abraham Kaplan

quoteText: Getting information off the Internet is like taking a drink from a fire hydrant.
author: Mitchell Kapor

quoteText: If men knew all that women think, they'd be twenty times more daring.
author: Alphonse Karr

quoteText: Some people are always grumbling because roses have thorns; I am thankful that thorns have roses.
author: Alphonse Karr

quoteText: If you want to earn a living, you just have to work; if you want to get rich, you have to find something else.
author: Alphonse Karr

quoteText: I think a dysfunctional family is any family with more than one person in it.
author: Mary Karr

quoteText: Even the best of us are at least part-time bastards.
author: Mary Karr

quoteText: In business as in life - you don't get what you deserve, you get what you negotiate.
author: Chester L. Karrass

quoteText: Unless you're in the trenches every day, you don't understand what issues are coming up.
author: Farooq Kathwari

quoteText: Does anyone know how the Bidens became multimillionaires while serving public office and teaching elementary school?

quoteText: I never knew what real happiness was until I got married and by then it was too late.

author: Kaufman's Law

quoteText: Constantly talking isn't necessarily communicating.

quoteText: Children are a great comfort in your old age - and they help you reach it faster, too.

quoteText: Industry jargon may not be a language your customer understands.

quoteText: Blind obedience is not the same as loyalty.
author: Reki Kawahara

quoteText: If you don't fail at least ninety percent of the time, you're not aiming high enough.

quoteText: Technology is anything that was invented after you were born, everything else is just stuff.
author: Alan Kay

quoteText: Perspective is worth eighty I.Q. points.
author: Alan Kay

quoteText: Why can't women put on mascara with their mouth closed?

quoteText: You know you've turned into your dad the day you put aside a thin piece of wood specifically to stir paint with.

quoteText: Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.

quoteText: They invented hugs to let people know you love them without saying anything.

quoteText: You do not destroy an idea by killing people; you replace it with a better one.

quoteText: Nothing ever becomes real till experienced.
author: John Keats

quoteText: Play is the work of children.  It's very serious stuff.
author: Bob Keeshan

quoteText: If you're not giving the world your best, what world are you saving it for?

quoteText: My father didn't tell me how to live; he lived, and let me watch him do it.

quoteText: The more time I spend with our people, the more I find out about our business.
author: Herb Kelleher

quoteText: There are a hundred roads to Rome; the important thing is to get there, not to use the same road.
author: Herb Kelleher

quoteText: The most un-American phrase in our modern vocabulary is "take-home pay."

quoteText: To know the history of science is to recognize the mortality of any claim to universal truth.

quoteText: College isn't a place to go for ideas.

quoteText: We could never learn to be brave and patient if there were only joy in the world.

quoteText: Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it.

quoteText: It is for us to pray not for tasks equal to our powers, but for powers equal to our tasks.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: It is wonderful how much time good people spend fighting the devil.  If they would only expend the same amount of energy loving their fellow men, the devil would die in his own tracks of ennui.

quoteText: The highest result of education is tolerance.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: The most pathetic person in the world is someone who has sight but has no vision.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.

quoteText: I learned that the power to rise in the world is not within the reach of everyone.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement.  Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: People do not like to think.  If one thinks, one must reach conclusions.  Conclusions are not always pleasant.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: A candle loses nothing by lighting another candle.

quoteText: A hero is someone we can admire without apology.
author: Kitty Kelley

quoteText: Dollars have never been known to produce character, and character will never be produced by money.

quoteText: Snowflakes are one of nature's most fragile things, but just look what they can do when they stick together.

quoteText: Don't take life too seriously.  It ain't nohow permanent.

quoteText: It's not good enough for things to be planned - they still have to be done.

quoteText: Winning is like shaving - you do it every day or you wind up looking like a bum.

quoteText: Quotes are nothing but inspiration for the uninspired.

quoteText: No great scoundrel is ever uninteresting.
author: Murray Kempton

quoteText: The news of Edward R. Murrow's death, reportedly from lung cancer, was followed by a cigarette commercial.

quoteText: Ambition never comes to an end.
author: Yoshida Kenko

quoteText: The biggest sin is sitting on your ass.

quoteText: If you bungle raising your children, I don't think whatever else you do well matters very much.

quoteText: Sincerity is always subject to proof.

quoteText: Too often we enjoy the comfort of opinion without the discomfort of thought.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Dealing with bureaucracy is like trying to nail jelly to the wall.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Those who foolishly sought power by riding the back of the tiger ended up inside.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.
author: John F. Kennedy
