author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Great crisis produce great men and great deeds of courage.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: The problems of the world cannot possibly be solved by skeptics or cynics whose horizons are limited by obvious realities.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: There are risks and costs to a program of action.  But they are far less than the long-range risks and costs of comfortable inaction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: The great enemy of the truth is very often not the lie . . . but the myth.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Forgive your enemies but never forget their names.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Things do not happen.  Things are made to happen.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: The greater our knowledge increases, the greater our ignorance unfolds.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Irrational barriers and ancient prejudices fall quickly when the question of survival itself is at stake.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Our task now is not to fix the blame for the past, but to fix the course for the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Too often we enjoy the comfort of opinion, without the discomfort of thought.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Of those to whom much is given, much is required.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: If we are strong, our strength will speak for itself.  If we are weak, words will be of no help.
author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: Tolerance implies no lack of commitment to one's own beliefs.  Rather it condemns the oppression or persecution of others.
author: John F. Kennedy

author: John F. Kennedy

quoteText: We cannot negotiate with those who say "What's mine is mine, what's yours is negotiable."
author: John F. Kennedy

author: Joseph P. Kennedy, Sr.

author: Robert Kennedy

author: Robert F. Kennedy

quoteText: What is dangerous about extremists is not that they are extreme, but that they are intolerant.  The evil is not what they say about their cause, but what they say about their opponents.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quoteText: You're happiest while you're making the greatest contribution.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quoteText: One fifth of the people are against everything all the time.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

quoteText: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
author: Robert F. Kennedy

author: Robert F. Kennedy

quoteText: He who angers you conquers you.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

author: Sherrilyn Kenyon

author: Kirk Kerkorian

quoteText: Circumstances never made the man do right who didn't do right in spite of them.
author: Coulson Kernahan

quoteText: Arguing on the internet is a tax on people who don't value their time.
author: Sean Kernan

quoteText: Great things are not accomplished by those who yield to trends and fads and popular opinion.

quoteText: One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple.
author: Jack Kerouac

author: Jean Kerr

author: Jean Kerr

quoteText: Even though a number of people have tried, no one has yet found a way to drink for a living.
author: Jean Kerr

quoteText: I make mistakes.  I'll be the second to admit it.
author: Jean Kerr

author: Jean Kerr

quoteText: If you can keep your head when all about you are losing theirs, it's just possible you haven't grasped the situation.
author: Jean Kerr

quoteText: Half the world is composed of idiots, the other half of people clever enough to take indecent advantage of them.
author: Walter Kerr

quoteText: How come dumb stuff seems so smart while you're doing it?
author: Hank Ketcham

quoteText: Flattery is like chewing gum.  Enjoy it but don't swallow it.
author: Hank Ketcham

quoteText: In America we can say what we think, and even if we can't think, we can say it anyhow.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: The world hates change, yet it is the only thing that has brought progress.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: People are very open-minded about new things - as long as they're exactly like the old ones.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: If you want to kill any idea in the world, get a committee working on it.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: So few have imagination that there are ten thousand fiddlers to one composer.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: The only time you mustn't fail is the last time you try.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: The faster you go, the more chance there is of stubbing your toe, but the more chance you have of getting somewhere.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: This problem, too, will look simple after it is solved.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: We have a lot of people revolutionizing the world because they've never had to present a working model.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: No one would have crossed the ocean if he could have gotten off the ship in the storm.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: You can't have a better tomorrow if you are thinking about yesterday all the time.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: People think of the inventor as a screwball, but no one ever asks the inventor what he thinks of other people.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: The Wright brothers flew right through the smoke screen of impossibility.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: It is amazing what ordinary people can do if they set out without preconceived notions.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: A problem well stated is a problem half-solved.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: It doesn't matter if you try and try and try again, and fail.  It does matter if you try and fail, and fail to try again.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: There is a great difference between knowing a thing and understanding it.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: You can be sincere and still be stupid.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: One of the things we have to be thankful for is that we don't get as much government as we pay for.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: If you have always done it that way, it is probably wrong.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: Problems are the price of progress.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: An inventor fails nine hundred ninety-nine times, and if he succeeds once, he's in.  He treats his failures simply as practice shots.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quoteText: At every step the child should be allowed to meet the real experiences of life, the thorns should never be plucked from his roses.
author: Ellen Key

quoteText: The worst barbarity of war is that it forces men collectively to commit acts against which individually they would revolt with their whole being. (1916)
author: Ellen Key

quoteText: Preferential affirmative action patronizes American blacks, women, and others by presuming that they cannot succeed on their own.
author: Alan Keyes

quoteText: The gun control mentality is ruthlessly absurd . . . you end up with a situation in which the law-abiding folks can't defend themselves, and the crooks have all the guns.
author: Alan Keyes

quoteText: Anything the government gives you is just another link in the chains that destroy your liberty.
author: Alan Keyes

quoteText: To be upset over what you don't have is to waste what you do have.
author: Ken Keyes, Jr.

quoteText: A loving person lives in a loving world.  A hostile person lives in a hostile world: everyone you meet is your mirror.
author: Ken Keyes, Jr.

quoteText: Everyone and everything around you is your teacher.
author: Ken Keyes, Jr.

quoteText: The affluent society has made everyone dislike work and come to think of idleness as the happiest life.
author: Geoffrey Keynes

quoteText: I do not know which makes a man more conservative -- to know nothing but the present, or nothing but the past.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quoteText: If you owe your bank a hundred pounds, you have a problem.  But if you owe a million, it has.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quoteText: The difficulty lies not so much in developing new ideas as in escaping from old ones.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quoteText: When the facts change, I change my mind.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quoteText: I work for a government I despise for ends I think criminal.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quoteText: Truth is now a hate crime.
author: Anna Khait

quoteText: Call it what you will, incentives are what get people to work harder.
author: Nikita Khrushchev

quoteText: If you live among wolves you have to act like a wolf.
author: Nikita Khrushchev

quoteText: If you feed the people just with revolutionary slogans they will listen today, they will listen tomorrow, they will listen the day after tomorrow, but on the fourth day they will say, "To hell with you."
author: Nikita Khrushchev

quoteText: Procrastination is opportunity's assassin.
author: Victor Kiam

quoteText: Entrepreneurs are simply those who understand that there is little difference between obstacle and opportunity and are able to turn both to their advantage.
author: Victor Kiam

quoteText: The weather is never so bad outside as it looks through a living room window.
author: John Kieran

quoteText: There's nothing more intoxicating than doing big, bold, things.
author: Jason Kilar

quoteText: Playboy is coming out with a magazine for married men - every month the same centerfold.
author: Craig Kilborn

quoteText: I was single for a long time, and I just got so sick of finishing my own sentences.
author: Brian Kiley

quoteText: The best and fastest way to learn a sport is to watch and imitate a champion.
author: Jean-Claude Killy

quoteText: A man should kiss his wife's navel every day.
author: Nell Kimball

quoteText: I like cooking, but I think someone else ought to do the dishes.
author: Jamaica Kincaid

quoteText: You do live longer with bran, but you spend the last fifteen years on the toilet.
author: Alan King

quoteText: Marriage is nature's way of keeping us from fighting with strangers.
author: Alan King

quoteText: I have a lot to say, and if I'm not number one, I can't say it.
author: Billie Jean King

quoteText: You don't get what you deserve, you get what you negotiate.
author: Don King

quoteText: Those who have succeeded at anything and don't mention luck are kidding themselves.
author: Larry King

quoteText: Nothing I say this day will teach me anything.  So if I'm going to learn, I must do it by listening.
author: Larry King

author: Larry King

quoteText: The fact that an 18 year old can't take out a $10,000 business loan but can take out a $100,000 student loan tells you everything you need to know.
author: Lawrence King

quoteText: A man can't ride your back unless it's bent.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: We may have all come on different ships, but we're in the same boat now.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, "What are you doing for others?"
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: When evil men plot, good men must plan.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: We need leaders not in love with money but in love with justice.  Not in love with publicity but in love with humanity.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Darkness cannot drive out darkness.  Only light can do that.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Our lives begin to end the day we become silent on things that matter.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: The hottest place in Hell is reserved for those who remain neutral in times of great moral conflict.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: A time comes when silence is betrayal.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Freedom is never voluntarily given by the oppressor; it must be demanded by the oppressed.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: He who passively accepts evil is as much involved in it as he who helps to perpetrate it.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: The best way to solve any problem is to remove its cause.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: When you are right you cannot be too radical; when you are wrong, you cannot be too conservative.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: The time is always right to do what is right.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Everybody can be great.  Because anybody can serve.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: He who accepts evil without protesting against it is really cooperating with it.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quoteText: Our strength is often composed of the weakness that we're damned if we are going to show.

quoteText: Women who feel naked without their lipstick are well over thirty.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: A critic can only review the book he has read, not the one which the writer wrote.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: We always prefer war on our own terms to peace on someone else's.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: The chief reason for drinking is the desire to behave in a certain way, and to be able to blame it on alcohol.

quoteText: If you have to do it every day, for God's sake learn to do it well.

quoteText: What you can't get out of, get into wholeheartedly.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: If everyone gave a tenth of his worldly goods to the person he most admired, the rich would just get richer.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: The proud man can learn humility, but he will be proud of it.

quoteText: Women usually love what they buy, yet hate two-thirds of what is in their closets
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: It's important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to the friendship that we are not.

quoteText: Every group feels strong once it has found a scapegoat.

quoteText: Every group of six or more has its inner circle, its outer circle, and its hangers-on.

quoteText: Happiness is like the penny candy of our youth: we got a lot more for our money back when we had no money.

quoteText: A sense of humor is a major defense against minor troubles.

quoteText: How strange that the young should always think the world is against them when in fact that is the only time it is for them.

quoteText: Whatever we worship, short of God, is sure to be our undoing.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: It's innocence when it charms us, ignorance when it doesn't.

quoteText: We tell our children things which we know are not so, but which we wish were so.

quoteText: Don't be yourself. Be someone a little nicer.

quoteText: Everybody can write; writers can't do anything else.

quoteText: Learning too soon our limitations, we never learn our powers.

quoteText: No one has ever loved anyone the way everyone wants to be loved.

quoteText: A successful marriage requires falling in love many times, always with the same person.

quoteText: After the chills and fever of love, how nice is the 98.6˚ of marriage.

quoteText: If you made a list of the reasons why any couple got married, and another list of the reasons for their divorce, you'd have a hell of a lot of overlapping.

quoteText: "Your money or your life." We know what to do when a burglar makes this demand of us, but not when God does.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: A hypochondriac is one who has a pill for everything except what ails him.

quoteText: With men, as with women, the main struggle is between vanity and comfort; but with men, comfort often wins.

quoteText: When a man comes to love a woman exactly as she had dreamed, she decides he is a weakling.

quoteText: Men who don't like girls with brains don't like girls.

quoteText: Men enjoy being thought of as hunters but are generally too lazy to hunt. Women, on the other hand, love to hunt, but would rather nobody knew it.

quoteText: It's hard to feel middle-aged, because how can you tell how long you are going to live?

quoteText: Throughout our lives, we see in the mirror the same innocent trusting face we have seen there since childhood.

quoteText: Puritans will never believe it, but life is full of disagreeable things that aren't even good for you.

quoteText: There are a handful of people whom money won't spoil, and we all count ourselves among them.

quoteText: Money - in its absence, we are coarse; in its presence, we are vulgar.

quoteText: What you were sure of yesterday, you know now to be false, but what you are sure of today is absolutely true.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: It's the most unhappy people who most fear change.

quoteText: Neurotics expect you to remember all the things that they tell you, and many that they don't

quoteText: No good neurotic finds it difficult to be both opinionated and indecisive.

quoteText: If only we could be old and sick while we're still young and healthy enough to put up with it!

quoteText: Hope is the feeling we have that the feeling we have is not permanent.

quoteText: Bored with your present enemies? Make new ones! Tell two of your women friends that they look alike.

quoteText: We waste a lot of time running after people we could have caught by just standing still.

quoteText: A parent who has never apologized to his children is a monster. If he's always apologizing, his children are monsters.

quoteText: We lavish on animals the love we are afraid to show people. They might not return it; or worse, they might.

quoteText: A woman will do anything to keep a pretty figure, but hardly anything to get one.

quoteText: How tired God must be of guilt and loneliness, for that is all we ever bring to Him.

quoteText: The poor have the same basic pleasures as the rich, and the rich will always resent it.

quoteText: Every society honors its live conformists and its dead troublemakers.

quoteText: The time to begin most things is ten years ago.

quoteText: At the beginning of a love affair, not even the neurotic is neurotic.

quoteText: Most sermons sound to me like commercials - but I can't make out whether God is the Sponsor or the Product.

quoteText: A husband only worries about a particular other man; a wife distrusts her whole species.

quoteText: The neurotic usually obeys his own Golden Rule: Hate thy neighbor as thyself.

quoteText: If you hate your lot but wouldn't trade it, it's not your lot you hate.

quoteText: It upsets women to be, or not to be, stared at hungrily.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: Boredom is often the cause of promiscuity and always its result.

quoteText: In every group of intimidated people, each thinks "I will rebel," but each waits for the others.

quoteText: Most women would like to dress imaginatively, but they glare at any woman who does.

quoteText: Spite is never lonely; envy always tags along.

quoteText: We are seldom happy with what we now have, but would go to pieces if we lost any part of it.

quoteText: Anything you lose automatically doubles in value.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: Even cowards can endure hardship; only the brave can endure suspense.

quoteText: Life marks us all down, so it's just as well that we start out by overpricing ourselves.

quoteText: After he has had his tantrum, the neurotic expects those around him to feel friendly and relaxed; after all, he does.

quoteText: Philosophy teaches a man that he can't take it with him; taxes teach him he can't leave it behind either.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: Traditions are group efforts to keep the unexpected from happening.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: Nobody knows the trouble we've seen - but we keep trying to tell them.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quoteText: The first two days of a vacation are endless; then it flies.

quoteText: Courage can't see around corners but goes around them anyway.

quoteText: Many who would not take the last cookie would take the last lifeboat.

quoteText: Groups of girls are pretty, or not; they are seldom mixed.

quoteText: Women are afraid of mice and of murder, and of very little in between.

quoteText: There is only one thing more painful than learning from experience and that is not learning from experience.

quoteText: Diaper backward spells repaid. Think about it.

quoteText: There are no passengers on spaceship earth. We are all crew.

quoteText: The answers are always inside the problem, not outside.

quoteText: Yes, risk-taking is inherently failure-prone. Otherwise, it would be called sure-thing-taking.

quoteText: Incompetents invariably make trouble for people other than themselves.

quoteText: If you wait, all that happens is that you get older.

quoteText: Experience may be the best teacher but the one I had in grammar school was much prettier.

quoteText: Comfort zones are most often expanded through discomfort.

quoteText: It is difficult to steer a parked car, so get moving.

quoteText: Nothing draws people more quickly away from religion than an open mind.

quoteText: You'll never find a better sparring partner than adversity.

quoteText: Men look at themselves in mirrors. Women look for themselves.

quoteText: Your Life is Now

quoteText: When someone offends you, you can raise your spirits to heights where offenses cannot reach.

quoteText: My commitment is not to consistency but to the truth.

quoteText: The best things in life cannot be willed into being.

quoteText: You can't mine coal without machine guns.

quoteText: If you have learned how to disagree without being disagreeable, then you discovered have the secret of getting along.

quoteText: Bachelors know more about women than married men; if they didn't they'd be married too.

quoteText: Human progress is furthered, not by conformity, but by aberration.

quoteText: Nothing can come out of an artist that is not in the man.

quoteText: There is no idea so stupid that you can't find a professor who will believe it.

quoteText: Criticism is prejudice made plausible.

quoteText: It is a sin to believe evil of others, but it is seldom a mistake.

quoteText: A man may be a fool and not know it, but not if he is married.

quoteText: Statistics: the only crystal ball approved by God.

quoteText: What the world needs is some "do give a damn pills."

quoteText: Weeping is perhaps the most human and universal of all relief measures.

quoteText: Generous people are rarely mentally ill people.

quoteText: The least of learning is done in the classrooms.

quoteText: There's never time to do it right, but always time to do it over.

quoteText: Habits are like supervisors that you don't notice.

quoteText: The rarest thing in the world is a woman who is pleased with photographs of herself.

quoteText: The best ad is a good product.

quoteText: Whoever perpetrated the mathematical inaccuracy, 'two can live as cheaply as one,' has a lot to answer for.

quoteText: I would rather stay positive and get fifty percent good results than stay negative and get one hundred percent bad results.

quoteText: Ninety percent of all those who fail are not actually defeated. They simply quit.

quoteText: The knowledge that a secret exists is half of the secret.

quoteText: Equality of sexes should involve sticking women in coal mines.

quoteText: We are never prepared for what we expect.

quoteText: After thirty, a body has a mind of its own.

quoteText: The worst part of success is to try to find someone who is happy for you.

quoteText: No virtue can be great if it is not constant.

quoteText: Isn't it amazing that there's no copyright on your own life?

quoteText: It is easy to ignore responsibility when one is only an intermediate link in the chain of action.

quoteText: Most conversations are simply monologues delivered in the presence of a witness.

quoteText: No trumpets sound when the important decisions of our life are made.

quoteText: Marriage does not unite two people; it entangles them.

quoteText: Never fight fair with a stranger, boy. You'll never get out of the jungle that way.

quoteText: If I see an ending, I can work backward.

quoteText: Everybody likes a kidder, but nobody lends him money.
author: Arthur Miller

quoteText: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets.
author: Arthur Miller

quoteText: Teaching a child not to step on a caterpillar is as valuable to the child as it is to the caterpillar.

quoteText: If you were everything a woman wanted, she wouldn't want you anymore.
author: Deejay Miller

quoteText: There are people who define themselves in America now solely through agitation. They have no life, except yours.

quoteText: You know there is a problem with the education system when you realize that out of the 3 R's only one begins with an R.

quoteText: A good rule of thumb is if you've made it to thirty-five and your job still requires you to wear a name tag, you've made a serious vocational error.

quoteText: Guilt is simply God's way of letting you know that you're having too good a time.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: Liberalism is like a nude beach: sounds good - till you get there.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: The IRS was flagging groups to be investigated because they had the word "patriot" in their name . . . is that not unbelievable to you that that's the word that gets you flagged.

quoteText: You gotta stay away from those marches, man, huh? Tricky out there - a lot of violent pacifists. A lot of young people with love in their hearts that want you dead if you're not loving enough.

quoteText: Washington, DC is to lying what Wisconsin is to cheese.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: Elected office holds more perks than Elvis' nightstand.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: I think Bernie is smart enough to know that there's great hay to be made convincing kids they don't need money to be truly rich. I think he wrote that in his third home - the one on the lake.

quoteText: It's official: names now hurt kids more than stick 'n stones.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: Social media has allowed us to all come together as one and realize there was really no reason whatsoever for us all to come together as one.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: With FaceBooking, texting, InstaGramming, and Tweeting . . . never have lives less lived been more chronicled.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: Isn't one of the most denigrating things you can do to another human being is have absolutely no expectations of them.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: After seven years of marriage, I'm sure of two things -- first, never wallpaper together, and second, you'll need two bathrooms - both for her.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: You know you're a workaholic when you're making a phone call from home, you hit "9" to get out.

quoteText: Two wrongs may not make a right, but a thousand wrongs make a writer.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: It's ironic that the only people in America unwilling to push the envelope are postal employees.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: I think teachers should take on students on a contingency basis, where they earn an eventual percentage of the child's adult earnings.  This would certainly light a fire under the teacher's ass to stress the basics.

quoteText: We are simultaneously the most hated, loved, feared and admired nation on this planet.  In short, we are Frank Sinatra.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: Hybrid technology . . . It sounds like a cute idea but I always get the feeling I'm getting screwed by OPEC and Enron at the same time.
author: Dennis Miller

quoteText: We've got better security at Borders bookstores now than we do at our actual borders . . . I don't have anything against Mexican people . . . but for Christ's sakes sign the guest book on the way in.

quoteText: If you're a smoker and you tell me that you didn't know cigarettes were bad for you, well you're lying through the hole in your trachea, my friend.

Then when Hitler attacked me and the Protestant Church - and there was nobody to be concerned.

quoteText: An ignorant person is one who doesn't know what you have just found out.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Ten men in our country could buy the whole world and ten million can't buy enough food.

quoteText: Buy land. They ain't making any more of the stuff.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Too many people spend money they haven't earned to buy things they don't want to impress people they don't like.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: What the country needs is dirtier fingernails and cleaner minds.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: All you need to grow fine, vigorous grass is a crack in your sidewalk.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: If you're ridin' ahead of the herd, take a look back every now and then to make sure it's still there.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Ancient Rome declined because it had a Senate, now what's going to happen to us with both a House and a Senate?
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Liberty doesn't work as well in practice as it does in speeches.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: People's minds are changed through observation and not through argument.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: One third of the people in the U.S. promote while the other two-thirds provide.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: The older we get, the fewer things seem worth waiting in line for.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: One must wait until evening to see how splendid the day has been.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: I don't know how I got over the hill without getting to the top.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Being young is beautiful but being old is comfortable.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Everything is funny as long as it is happening to someone else.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: The more you observe politics, the more you've got to admit that each party is worse than the other.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: No party is as bad as its leaders.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Nobody wants to be called common people, especially common people.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: I don't care which side my bread is buttered on. I always eat both sides anyway.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: All I know is just what I read in the papers, and that's an alibi for my ignorance.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: One ad is worth more to a paper than forty editorials.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: If advertisers spent the same amount of money on improving their products as they do on advertising then they wouldn't have to advertise them.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Live in such a way that you would not be ashamed to sell your parrot to the town gossip.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Rumor travels faster but it don't stay put as long as truth.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: There is nothing so stupid as the educated man if you get him off the thing he was educated in.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: There ain't nothing but one thing wrong with every one of us, and that's selfishness.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Nothing you can't spell will ever work.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Never miss a good chance to shut up.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: If stupidity got us into this mess, then why can't it get us out?
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: The only difference between death and taxes is death doesn't get worse every time Congress meets.

quoteText: The income tax has made more liars out of the American people than golf has.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Plans get you into things, but you got to work your way out.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Worrying is like paying on a debt that may never come due.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: When you are dissatisfied and would like to go back to youth, think of algebra.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: Showgirls are so beautiful, it is sad to think that twenty years from now they will all be five years older.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: The walls we build around us to keep sadness out also keeps out the joy.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: Give whatever you are doing and whoever you are with the gift of your attention.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: We must all suffer from one of two pains: the pain of discipline or the pain of regret.

quoteText: The more you know the less you need to say.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: There are only three colors, ten digits, and seven notes; it's what we do with them that's important.

quoteText: Success is nothing more than a few simple disciplines, practiced every day.

quoteText: If you really want to do something, you'll find a way. If you don't, you'll find an excuse.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: Formal education will make you a living; self-education will make you a fortune.

quoteText: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.

quoteText: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.

quoteText: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.

quoteText: The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: You cannot change your destination overnight, but you can change your direction overnight
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: Things that I felt absolutely sure of but a few years ago, I do not believe now. This thought makes me see more clearly how foolish it would be to expect all men to agree with me.

quoteText: Most people plan their vacations with better care than they plan their lives. Perhaps that is because escape is easier than change.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.

quoteText: Better understated than overstated. Let people be surprised that it was more than you promised and easier than you said.

quoteText: By working hard, you get to play hard guilt-free.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: Religion either produces the very best people of the very worst.
author: Richard Rohr

quoteText: A hero is a man who does what he can.
author: Romain Rolland

quoteText: I love capitalism. It rewards me for being brave - it awards me for being innovative and thinking out-of-the-box.

quoteText: Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue.
author: Henry Rollins

quoteText: To hate is to show you still care.
author: Henry Rollins

quoteText: If I had to live my life in anticipation of what others thought of me, little would get done.

quoteText: More and more, journalism seems to have hopped out of Truth's pocket and crept into another.

quoteText: You must do what others don't to achieve what others won't.

quoteText: There's a lot of mountain climbers trapped inside bodies of people behind the counter at Kinko's.

quoteText: A universal stupidity is the belief that our neighbor's success is the cause of our failure.

quoteText: Prejudice against innovation is a typical characteristic of an officer corps which has grown up in a well-tried and proven system.

quoteText: The best classroom in the world is at the feet of an elderly person.

quoteText: Life is like a roll of toilet paper. The closer to the end you get, the faster it goes.

quoteText: We should be glad God doesn't give us everything we ask for.

quoteText: Never say no to a gift from a child.

quoteText: The less time I have to work with, the more things I get done.

quoteText: Some people's idea of patriotism is hating other countries.

quoteText: A smile is an inexpensive way to improve your looks.

quoteText: Elephants and grandchildren never forget.

quoteText: Everyone wants to live on top of the mountain, but all the happiness and growth occurs while you're climbing it.

quoteText: Making duplicate copies and computer printouts of things no one wanted even one of in the first place is giving America a new sense of purpose.

quoteText: Being kind is more important than being right.

quoteText: Life is tough, but I'm tougher.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: We're all proud of making little mistakes. It gives us the feeling we don't make any big ones.

quoteText: People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: To ignore the facts does not change the facts.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: I didn't get old on purpose, it just happened. If you're lucky, it could happen to you.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: Opportunities are never lost; someone will take the ones you miss.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: If dogs could talk it would take a lot of the fun out of owning one.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: Money doesn't buy class.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: I'd be more willing to accept religion, even if I didn't believe it, if I thought it made people nicer to each other but I don't think it does.

quoteText: When you plan to get even with someone, you are only letting that person continue to hurt you.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: Vegetarian: that's an old Indian word meaning "lousy hunter."
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: Death is a distant rumor to the young.
author: Andy Rooney

quoteText: It takes as much energy to wish as it does to plan.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: Anger is only one letter short of danger.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: If someone betrays you once, it's their fault; if they betray you twice, it's your fault.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: Beautiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: More people are ruined by victory, I imagine, than by defeat.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: Courage is more exhilarating than fear, and in the long run it is easier.

quoteText: It's better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: A woman is like a teabag - only in hot water do you realize how strong she is.

quoteText: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.

quoteText: When you cease to make a contribution you begin to die.

quoteText: Justice cannot be for one side alone but must be for both.

quoteText: No leader can be too far ahead of his followers.

quoteText: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.

quoteText: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.

quoteText: You always admire what you really don't understand.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: When will our consciences grow so tender that we will act to prevent human misery rather than avenge it?

quoteText: We cannot always build the future for our youth, but we can build our youth for the future.

quoteText: Remember always that all of us . . . are descended from immigrants and revolutionists.

quoteText: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.

quoteText: Never underestimate a man who overestimates himself.

quoteText: Peace, like charity, begins at home.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quoteText: Every man has a right to life. That means that he also has a right to make a comfortable living.

quoteText: There is no indispensable human.

quoteText: If you treat people right they will treat you right - ninety percent of the time.

quoteText: Repetition does not transform a lie into the truth.

quoteText: The ablest man I ever met is the man you think you are.

quoteText: If I went to work in a factory, the first thing I'd do would be to join a union.

quoteText: The best customer of American industry is the well-paid worker.

quoteText: Men do not fail, they stop trying.

quoteText: Truths of the past are clichés of the present.

quoteText: It isn't evil that is ruining the earth, but mediocrity.

quoteText: If you want your child to walk the righteous path, do not merely point the way - lead the way.

quoteText: When something important is going on, silence is a lie.

quoteText: The universe is so vast and so ageless that the life of one man can only be justified by the measure of his sacrifice.

quoteText: Better by far you should forget and smile than that you should remember and be sad.
author: Christina G. Rossetti

quoteText: If ignorance is bliss, why aren't more people happy?

quoteText: A man is not old as long as he is seeking something.

quoteText: To love an idea is to love it a little more than one should.

quoteText: There are certain moments when we might wish the future were built by men of the past.

quoteText: We spend our time envying people whom we wouldn't wish to be.

quoteText: It takes a very deep-rooted opinion to survive unexpressed.

quoteText: Those who do not know fear are not truly brave.

quoteText: It's very easy to find something you were not looking for.

quoteText: Extremists think "communication" means agreeing with them.

quoteText: Jargon is not insight.

quoteText: I learned that it is the weak who are cruel, and that gentleness is to be expected only from the strong.

quoteText: First-rate men hire first-rate men; second-rate men hire third-rate men.

quoteText: If it takes a lot of words to say what you have in mind, give it more thought.

quoteText: What you do to get somewhere is who you become when you arrive.

quoteText: It is easy to be conspicuously"compassionate" if others are being forced to pay the cost.

quoteText: There are few things as nauseating as pure obedience.

quoteText: Human instincts are hard-wired programming.

quoteText: To play billiards well is a sign of ill-spent youth.

quoteText: You will never win if you never begin.

quoteText: Marriage is the miracle that transforms a kiss from a pleasure into a duty.

quoteText: When you see what some women marry, you realize how they must hate to work for a living.

quoteText: In olden times sacrifices were made at the altar - a practice which is still continued.

quoteText: There are only two kinds of perfectly faultless men - the dead and the deadly.

quoteText: A man never knows how to say goodbye; a woman never knows when to say it.

quoteText: A woman need only know one man well in order to understand all men, whereas a man may know all women and not understand one of them.
author: Helen Rowland

quoteText: The chief excitement in a woman's life is spotting women who are fatter than she is
author: Helen Rowland

quoteText: Indifference and neglect often do much more damage than outright dislike.

quoteText: It is the unknown we fear when we look upon death and darkness, nothing more.

quoteText: People find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right.
author: J. K. Rowling

quoteText: Youth cannot know how age thinks and feels, but old men are guilty, if they forget what it was to be young.

quoteText: I believe the physics of resisting power is as old as the physics of accumulating power. That's what keeps the balance in the universe . . . the refusal to obey.

quoteText: It's a circle. Work and confidence. And more work and more confidence.
author: Darrell Royal

quoteText: Whatever is rightly done, however humble, is noble.
author: Sir Henry Royce

quoteText: The quality will remain long after the price is forgotten.
author: Sir Henry Royce

quoteText: Take the best that exists and make it better. When it does not exist, design it.
author: Sir Henry Royce

quoteText: You can recognize a pioneer by the arrows in his back.
author: Beverly Rubik

quoteText: Blind obedience to authority is the real root of all evil.

quoteText: The problem is not that there are problems. The problem is expecting otherwise and thinking that having problems is a problem.

quoteText: Most people ask for happiness on condition. Happiness can only be felt if you don't set any condition.

quoteText: I have found that if you love life, life will love you back.
author: Arthur Rubinstein

quoteText: Whether you are sixteen or over sixty, remember, understatement is the rule of a fine makeup artist.

quoteText: There are no ugly women, only lazy ones.
author: Helena Rubinstein

quoteText: Simplicity is a sign of truth and a criterion of beauty. Complexity can be a way of hiding the truth.
author: Helena Rubinstein

quoteText: To use the term blind faith, is to use an adjective needlessly.

quoteText: Not one man in a beer commercial has a beer belly.
author: Rita Rudner

quoteText: My husband thinks that health food is anything you eat before the expiration date.
author: Rita Rudner

quoteText: When I eventually met Mr. Right I had no idea that his first name was Always.
author: Rita Rudner

quoteText: Maybe I'm paranoid, but in this day and age, I don't want something around my neck that's worth more than my head.

quoteText: One of my friends told me she was in labor for 36 hours. I don't even want to do anything that feels good for 36 hours.

quoteText: I love being married. It's so great to find that one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life.
author: Rita Rudner

quoteText: People think having large breasts makes a woman stupid . . . a woman having large breasts makes men stupid.
author: Rita Rudner

quoteText: Patience is the ability to put up with people you'd like to put down.

quoteText: Don't take anything personally. Nothing others do is because of you . . . When you are immune to the opinions and actions of others, you won't be the victim of needless suffering.

quoteText: Freedoms voluntarily sacrificed will not be voluntarily returned.

quoteText: We spend too much of our time "fixing" people who are not broken, and not enough time fixing organization systems that are broken.

quoteText: If you pit a good performer against a bad system, the system will win almost every time.
author: Geary A. Rummler

quoteText: If you are not criticized, you may not be doing much.
author: Donald H. Rumsfeld

quoteText: You go to war with the army you have, not the army you might want or wish to have at a later time.

quoteText: It is easier to get into something than to get out of it.
author: Donald H. Rumsfeld

quoteText: Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quoteText: People without a sense of humor very often lack proportion and shouldn't be put in charge of anything.
author: Robert Runcie

quoteText: You cannot train a horse with shouts and expect it to obey a whisper.
author: Dagobert D. Runes

quoteText: Work is man's most natural form of relaxation.
author: Dagobert D. Runes

quoteText: When thought becomes excessively painful, action is the finest remedy.

quoteText: Faith without doubt is addiction.
author: Salman Rushdie

quoteText: It is very, very easy not to be offended by a book. You just have to shut it.
author: Salman Rushdie

quoteText: I do not envy people who think they have a complete explanation of the world, for the simple reason that they are obviously wrong.
author: Salman Rushdie

quoteText: "Respect for religion" has become a code phrase meaning "fear of religion."
author: Salman Rushdie

quoteText: What is freedom of expression? Without the freedom to offend, it ceases to exist.
author: Salman Rushdie

quoteText: Fundamentalism isn't about religion, it's about power.
author: Salman Rushdie

quoteText: The best way to persuade people is with your ears - by listening to them.
author: Dean Rusk

quoteText: People can only agree about what they're not really interested in.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: Worry comes from not facing unpleasant possibilities.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: Few people can be happy unless they hate some other person, nation or creed.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: Boredom is . . . a vital problem for the moralist, since at least half the sins of mankind are caused by the fear of it.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: What men want is not knowledge, but certainty.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: When a man tells you that he knows the exact truth about anything, you are safe in inferring that he is an inexact man.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: Even when the experts all agree, they may well be mistaken.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: The reformative effect of punishment is a belief that dies hard, chiefly I think, because it is so satisfying to our sadistic impulses.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: All movements go too far.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: The central problem of our age is how to act decisively in the absence of certainty.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: Democracy is the process by which people choose the man who'll get the blame.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: Envy is the basis of democracy.
author: Bertrand Russell

quoteText: No matter how thin you slice it, it's still baloney.
author: Alfred E. Smith

quoteText: Enjoy the little things in life, for one day you may look back and realize they were the big things.
author: Antonio Smith

quoteText: To look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.
author: Betty Smith

quoteText: If you treat every situation as a life-and-death matter, you'll die a lot of times.

quoteText: Arguing with a fool proves there are two.
author: Doris M. Smith

quoteText: All good qualities in a child are the result of environment, while all the bad ones are the result of poor heredity on the side of the other parent.

quoteText: When someone has the wit to coin a useful phrase, it ought to be acclaimed and broadcast or it will perish.

quoteText: One of the best parts of growing older? You can flirt all you like since you've become harmless.

quoteText: The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves.

quoteText: You cannot be both fashionable and first-rate.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: The denunciation of the young is a necessary part of the hygiene of older people, and greatly assists in the circulation of their blood.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: He who goes against the fashion is himself its slave.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: The test of enjoyment is the remembrance which it leaves behind.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: There are two things to aim at in life: first, to get what you want; and, after that, to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: It is the wretchedness of being rich that you have to live with rich people.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: Don't laugh at a youth for his affectations; he is only trying on one face after another to find his own.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: What's more enchanting than the voices of young people, when you can't hear what they say?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: Don't tell your friends their social faults: they will cure the fault and never forgive you.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: All reformers, however strict their social conscience, live in houses just as big as they can pay for.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: Most people sell their souls, and live with a good conscience on the proceeds.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quoteText: Can you imagine a world without men? No crime and lots of happy, fat women.
author: Marion Smith

quoteText: Retreat, hell! We're not retreating, we're just advancing in a different direction.
author: Gen. Oliver Smith

quoteText: It is well known that the older a man grows, the faster he could run as a boy.
author: Red Smith

quoteText: The successful man is the one who finds out what is the matter with his business before his competitors do.
author: Roy L. Smith

quoteText: We are apt to forget that children watch examples better than they listen to preaching.
author: Roy L. Smith

quoteText: The best things in life are appreciated most after they have been lost.
author: Roy L. Smith

quoteText: If your mind goes blank, don't forget to turn off the sound.
author: Steven Smith

quoteText: Never trust a woman whose father calls her "Princess." Chances are she believes it.
author: Wes Smith

quoteText: I can't think of anything less worth striving for than fame.
author: Zadie Smith

quoteText: When you don't know what you're talking about, it's hard to know when you're finished.
author: Tom Smothers

quoteText: The only valid censorship of ideas is the right of people not to listen.
author: Tom Smothers

quoteText: Those who know the least always seem to know it the loudest.
author: Reg Smythe

quoteText: A male gynecologist is like an auto mechanic who has never owned a car.

quoteText: "The pursuit of happiness" is a most ridiculous phrase; if you pursue happiness, you'll never find it.
author: C. P. Snow

quoteText: Far more, and far more hideous, crimes have been committed in the name of obedience than have ever been committed in the name of rebellion.
author: C. P. Snow

quoteText: To the world you may be just one person, but to one person you may be the world.
author: Brandi Snyder

quoteText: History does not repeat, but it does instruct
author: Timothy Snyder

quoteText: The attempt to silence a man is the greatest honor you can bestow on him. It means that you recognize his superiority to yourself.
author: Joseph Sobran

quoteText: The Constitution poses no threat to our current form of government.
author: Joseph Sobran

quoteText: Freedom has ceased to be a birthright; it has come to mean whatever we are still permitted to do.
author: Joseph Sobran

quoteText: In 100 years, we have gone from teaching Latin and Greek in high school to teaching remedial English in college.
author: Joseph Sobran

quoteText: Tyranny may creep in under the outward forms of traditional law.
author: Joseph Sobran

quoteText: The difference between a politician and a pickpocket is that a pickpocket doesn't always get indignant when you tell him to keep his hands to himself.
author: Joseph Sobran

quoteText: Memories of past experiences may be even sweeter than these experiences were in reality.

quoteText: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
author: Ralph W. Sockman

quoteText: Blasphemy is the crime of not taking someone's beliefs as seriously as they do.
author: Jasper Sole

quoteText: Everything you add to the truth subtracts from the truth.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quoteText: Can a man who is warm understand one who is freezing?
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quoteText: If one is forever cautious, can one remain a human being?
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quoteText: When truth is discovered by someone else, it loses something of its attractiveness.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quoteText: You only have power over people so long as you don't take everything away from them. But when you've robbed a man of everything he's no longer in your power - he's free again.

quoteText: Happiness is never stopping to think if you are.
author: Palmer Sondreal

quoteText: I envy paranoids; they actually feel people are paying attention to them.

quoteText: Taste has no system and no proofs.
author: Susan Sontag

quoteText: Ambition, if it feeds at all, does so on the ambition of others.
author: Susan Sontag

quoteText: False values begin with the worship of things.
author: Susan Sontag

quoteText: Remember how, before the internet, people used to think the cause of stupidity was lack of access to information? Yea, it wasn't that.

quoteText: This should be a giant billboard in every city in the U.S. "America does not need to see the tax return of a billionaire who became a public servant. America needs to see the tax returns of public servants who became millionaires while being public servants."

quoteText: If the government can just print money, why am I paying taxes?
author: Kevin Sorbo

quoteText: If I had a dollar for every time socialism worked, I would have $0.00.
author: Kevin Sorbo

quoteText: If you're never scared or embarrassed or hurt, it means you never take any chances.

quoteText: I am all for everyone having a voice, I just don't think everyone has earned the microphone. And that's what the Internet has done.

quoteText: The upside of web-based journalism is that everybody gets a chance. The downside is that everybody gets a chance.

quoteText: I think socializing on the Internet is to socializing what reality TV is to reality.
author: Aaron Sorkin

quoteText: The Internet, in general, I find troubling. The anonymity has made us all meaner and dumber. This thing that was supposed to bring us closer together, I see it doing the opposite.

quoteText: I do not believe in the word fate. It is the refuge of every self-confessed failure.

quoteText: The only people with whom you should try to get even are those who have helped you.
author: John E. Southard

quoteText: The big divide in this country is not between Democrats and Republicans, or women and men, but between talkers and doers.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: You will never understand bureaucracies until you understand that for bureaucrats procedure is everything and outcomes are nothing.

quoteText: It is hard to imagine a more stupid or more dangerous way of making decisions than by putting those decisions in the hands of people who pay no price for being wrong.

quoteText: The political left's attempts to silence ideas they cannot, or will not, debate are a confession of intellectual bankruptcy.

quoteText: It is self-destructive for any society to create a situation where a baby who is born into the world today automatically has pre-existing grievances against another baby born at the same time, because of what their ancestors did centuries ago.

quoteText: There are no solutions; there are only trade-offs.

quoteText: The reason so many people misunderstand so many issues is not that these issues are so complex, but that people do not want a factual or analytical explanation that leaves them emotionally unsatisfied. They want villains to hate and heroes to cheer - and they don't want explanations that do not give them that.

quoteText: If crime is a product of poverty and discrimination as they say endlessly, why was there so much less of it when poverty and discrimination were much worse than today?

quoteText: If sanity ever returns to our society and we stop taking pretentious elites seriously, one of the signs will be that the public will force the removal of those ugly pieces of twisted metal that are called "art" in front of government buildings.

quoteText: The leaders of groups that are lagging are often themselves one of the biggest handicaps of those groups.

quoteText: Virtually everybody is worse off than somebody else . . . so there are nearly unlimited opportunities to pander to people's sense of injustice, victimhood and entitlement.

quoteText: There has never been a shortage of people eager to draw up blueprints for running other people's lives.

quoteText: Teachers' unions often say that teachers deserve higher pay because they are doing an important job. But if you are doing an important job badly, you are doing more harm than if you were doing some minor job badly.

quoteText: Too much of what is called "education" is little more than an expensive isolation from reality.

quoteText: What does "economic justice" mean, except that you want something that someone else produced, without having to produce anything yourself in return?

quoteText: One of the consequences of such notions as "entitlements" is that people who have contributed nothing to society feel society owes them something, apparently just for being nice enough to grace us with their presence.

quoteText: If there is not equality of outcomes among people born to the same parents and raised under the same roof, why should equality of outcomes be expected - or assumed - when conditions are not nearly so comparable?

quoteText: Life in general has never been even close to fair, so the pretense that the government can make it fair is a valuable and inexhaustible asset to politicians who want to expand government.

quoteText: The problem with trying to equalize is that you can usually only equalize downward.

quoteText: I had just as much opportunity to play basketball as Michael Jordan had. You cannot measure opportunities by outcomes.

quoteText: One of the scariest things about our times is how easy it is to scare people and start a political stampede. There are people who could be upset if they were told that half of all Americans earn less than the median income - though of course that is the way median income is defined.

quoteText: Freedom has cost too much blood and agony to be relinquished at the cheap price of rhetoric.

quoteText: In a democracy, we have always had to worry about the ignorance of the uneducated. Today we have to worry about the ignorance of people with college degrees.

quoteText: One of the most important reasons for studying history is that virtually every stupid idea that is in vogue today has been tried before and proved disastrous before, time and again.

quoteText: The engineer is judged by the end product, which is not simply ideas. If he builds a building that collapses, it doesn't matter how brilliant his idea was - he's ruined. Conversely, if an intellectual who is brilliant has an idea for rearranging society and that ends in disaster, he pays no price at all.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: There are few things more dishonorable than misleading the young.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: It is so easy to be wrong - and to persist in being wrong - when the costs of being wrong are paid by others.

quoteText: Too many journalists see their work as an opportunity to promote their own pet political notions, rather than a responsibility to inform the public and let their readers and viewers decide for themselves.

quoteText: I suspect that even most conservatives would prefer to live in the kind of world conjured up in the liberals' imagination rather than in the kind of world we are in fact stuck with.

quoteText: Politeness and consideration for others is like investing pennies and getting dollars back.

quoteText: It's sad we're at the mercy of people who think it's their job to filter out what we're going to be allowed to know instead of giving it to us straight.

quoteText: The least productive people are usually the ones who are most in favor of holding meetings.

quoteText: No society ever thrived because it had a large and growing class of parasite living off those who produce.

quoteText: Everybody thinks their cause is just. Does that mean nobody has to obey the rules?

quoteText: There are too many people who think in terms of talking points instead of thinking in terms of getting at the realities of the situation.

quoteText: If you're going to call the negative consequences of chosen behavior "disadvantage," the word is corrupt beyond repair.

quoteText: Politics is the art of making your selfish desires seem like the national interest.

quoteText: Most problems do not get solved. They get superseded by other concerns.

quoteText: Racism is not dead but it is on life support - kept alive by politicians, race hustlers and people who get a sense of superiority by denouncing others as "racists."

quoteText: Credentialed ignorance is still ignorance.

quoteText: Immigration laws are the only laws that are discussed in terms of how to help people who break them.

quoteText: It is amazing that people who think we cannot afford to pay for doctors, hospitals, and medication somehow think that we can afford to pay for doctors, hospitals, medication and a government bureaucracy to administer it.

quoteText: Some of the most vocal critics of the way things are being done are people who have done nothing themselves, and whose only contribution to society are their complaints and moral exhibitionism.

quoteText: It's amazing how many people think they are doing blacks a favor by exempting them from the standards others are expected to meet.

quoteText: Talkers are usually more articulate than doers, since talk is their specialty.

quoteText: The welfare state has always been judged by its good intentions, rather than its bad results.

quoteText: Do countries with strong gun control laws have lower murder rates?  Only if you cherry-pick the data.

quoteText: The great thing about democracy is that it gives every voter a chance to do something stupid.

quoteText: The longer you stay in one place, the greater your chances of disillusionment.

quoteText: Be on the alert to recognize your prime at whatever time of your life it may occur.

quoteText: It is impossible to persuade a man who does not disagree, but smiles.

quoteText: When you talk you repeat what you already know, when you listen you often learn something.

quoteText: One seldom recognizes the devil when he is putting his hand on your shoulder.

quoteText: I would rather have a mind opened by wonder than one closed by belief.

quoteText: Husbands don't really count . . . in the miracle of birth.

quoteText: Being anti-white is racism. Being anti-black is racism. It's no difference. It's not reverse racism. It's just racism.

quoteText: Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do.

quoteText: Truth invites inquiry, falsehood dreads examination.

quoteText: It is easy for a man with nothing to say to keep quiet.

quoteText: There are no failures at a class reunion.

quoteText: Unions have been the only powerful and effective voice working people have ever had in the history of this country.

quoteText: Success makes life easier. It doesn't make living easier.

quoteText: Blind faith in your leaders, or in anything, will get you killed.

quoteText: Any culture that rewards those promoting violence among its men, the disrespect and degradation of its women, and drug abuse among its youth is going to be in world of trouble.

quoteText: The greatest gift a parent can give a child is self-confidence.

quoteText: Science cannot stop while ethics catches up.
author: Elvin C. Stakman

quoteText: You have to do what you don't want to do to get what you want.
author: Dawn Staley

quoteText: It is easy to dodge our responsibilities, but we cannot dodge the consequences of dodging our responsibilities.

quoteText: Sometimes the best way to get someone's attention is to stop giving them yours.

quoteText: No matter what happens, there's always somebody who knew it would.

quoteText: If vegetarianism is so great, then why are they always trying to replicate meat?

quoteText: We have a whole generation of black leaders who do one thing and one thing only: milk white guilt.

quoteText: Personal responsibility is the brick and mortar of power.

quoteText: I think one of the cruelest things a society can do is to take the best and the brightest young black Americans and basically say to them "you simply cannot compete with the best and the brightest of other races. We won't allow you to do that."
author: Shelby Steele

quoteText: Unethical advertising uses falsehoods to deceive the public; ethical advertising uses truth to deceive the public.
author: Vilhjalmur Stefansson

quoteText: You can do what you think you can do and you cannot do what you think you cannot.

quoteText: The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: Decide what you want.

quoteText: We are always the same age inside.

quoteText: Money is always there but the pockets change.

quoteText: Silent gratitude isn't very much use to anyone.

quoteText: If things happen all the time you are never nervous. It is when they are not happening that you are nervous.

quoteText: Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.

quoteText: When you get there, there isn't any there there.
author: Gertrude Stein

quoteText: There ain't no answer. There ain't gonna be any answer. There never has been an answer. That's the answer.

quoteText: Considering how dangerous everything is, nothing is really very frightening.
author: Gertrude Stein

quoteText: One must either accept some theory or else believe one's own instinct or follow the world's opinion.

quoteText: I do want to get rich but I never want to do what there is to get rich.

quoteText: It takes a lot of time to be a genius, you have to sit around so much doing nothing, really doing nothing.

quoteText: The father who laughs with his kids more than he lectures them is way ahead of the game

quoteText: No one wants advice - only corroboration.

quoteText: One can find so many pains when the rain is falling.

quoteText: It is the nature of a man as he grows older to protest against change - particularly changes for the better
author: John Steinbeck

quoteText: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts . . . perhaps the fear of a loss of power.

quoteText: Time is the only critic without ambition.

quoteText: All war is a symptom of man's failure as a thinking animal.

quoteText: Man is the only kind of varmint sets his own trap, baits it, and then steps in it.

quoteText: We spend our time searching for security and hate it when we get it.

quoteText: Familiarity breeds inattention.

quoteText: No matter how much we have we will not be happy - because we will always want to have something else or something more.

quoteText: Voting isn't the most we can do, but it is the least.

quoteText: Self-esteem isn't everything; it's just that there's nothing without it.

quoteText: Most women's magazines simply try to mold women into bigger and better consumers.

quoteText: Most American children suffer too much mother and too little father.

quoteText: When you're depressed, nothing matters; when you're sad, everything does.

quoteText: A pedestal is as much a prison as any small, confined space.

quoteText: The first problem for all of us, men and women, is not to learn, but to unlearn.

quoteText: Rich people plan for three generations. Poor people plan for Saturday night.

quoteText: If men could get pregnant, abortion would be a sacrament.

quoteText: It's an incredible con job when you think about it, to believe something now in exchange for something after death. Even corporations with their reward systems don't try to make it posthumous.

author: Dick Van Dyke

quoteText: Many marriages would be better if the husband and the wife clearly understood that they are on the same side.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: Many people spend more time in planning the wedding than they do in planning the marriage.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: A second chance doesn't mean anything if you haven't learned from your first mistake.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: Money will buy you a bed but not a good night's sleeps, a house but not a home, a companion but not a friend.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: The best way to raise positive children in a negative world is to have positive parents who love them unconditionally and serve as excellent role models.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: If you're sincere, praise is effective. If you're insincere, it's manipulative.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: When you are tough on yourself, life is going to be infinitely easier on you.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: If there were no problems, most of us would be unemployed.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: If you learn from defeat, you haven't really lost.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: The price of success is much lower than the price of failure.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: The only thing worse than training employees and losing them is to not train them and keep them.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: Power of the people on top depends on the obedience of the people below. When people stop obeying, they have no power.
author: Howard Zinn

quoteText: Historically, the most terrible things - war, genocide, and slavery - have resulted not from disobedience, but from obedience.
author: Howard Zinn

quoteText: The strike, the boycott, the refusal to serve, the ability to paralyze the functioning of a complex social structure - these remain potent weapons against the most fearsome state or corporate power.
author: Howard Zinn

quoteText: Most wars, after all, present themselves as humanitarian endeavors to help people.
author: Howard Zinn

quoteText: You can't stop the waves, but you can learn to surf.
author: Jon Kabat-Zinn

quoteText: Just because people work for an institution doesn't mean they have to sound like one.
author: William K. Zinsser

quoteText: Clutter is the disease of American writing. We are a society strangling in unnecessary words, circular constructions, pompous frills and meaningless jargon.
author: William K. Zinsser

quoteText: There's nothing like being a dad. Though shoveling money down a bottomless hole comes close.
author: Myra Zirkle

quoteText: We don't want a memory that tells us the truth, we want a memory that makes us happy.
author: Koos van Zomeren

quoteText: If you are terrified of short-term failure, then you will never achieve long-term success.
author: Zuby

quoteText: As far as I can tell, the Black Lives Matter movement has resulted in more black deaths, increased crime in minority communities and loss of livelihoods in places affected by riots and looting. It also made race relations worse.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Most important public conversations have become very one-sided in recent years, with the other side silenced, or not fairly represented.
author: Zuby

quoteText: If I were an evil genius looking to stir racial tension, I'd: 1.) Tell black and brown people that white people are oppressing them 2.) Tell white people they're inherently privileged, guilty and fragile 3.) amplify every story and video that fits above narrative 4.) Watch and laugh.
author: Zuby

quoteText: I look forward to people who have polluted the earth with billions of unnecessary face masks lecturing us about "protecting the environment" soon. But hey, at least they used a paper straw once.
author: Zuby

quoteText: If you don't use your free speech, it gets taken from you.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Nobody who is happy, successful, and fulfilled will ever hate on you.
author: Zuby

quoteText: The average jacked guy in any gym can give you better practical health advice than the majority of "public health experts."
author: Zuby

quoteText: Imagine spending $100,000+ on your child's education for them to be brainwashed into hating you, other people, and their whole country.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Certain university degrees are essentially pyramid schemes. The only way you can make money from them is by teaching the subject matter to other people, since it has zero (or negative) real world practical value.
author: Zuby

quoteText: The smartest people say "I don't know" the most frequently.
author: Zuby

quoteText: The media lies so much that when you tell people the truth, they say you're "spreading misinformation."
author: Zuby

quoteText: You cannot comply your way out of tyranny.
author: Zuby

quoteText: If no one is giving you opportunities, create your own.
author: Zuby

quoteText: You can oppress people either by actually oppressing them, or by brainwashing them into believing they are oppressed.
author: Zuby

quoteText: When people are too comfortable, they invent new "problems" to solve.
author: Zuby

quoteText: "Problems" are often manufactured intentionally so that "cures" can be sold. Think about it.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Being unnecessarily rude will lose you a lot of opportunities in life.
author: Zuby

quoteText: People get so excited when the government gives their own money back to them.
author: Zuby

quoteText: I've noticed that people who are obsessed with race see racism everywhere and those who aren't don't.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Ironically, the people who champion themselves as "anti-racists" are currently doing more to keep racism alive than the KKK.
author: Zuby

quoteText: How you treat people with different political and religious views says more about your true character than your political and religious view.
author: Zuby

quoteText: It's wild how most people don't understand that government scientists and "experts" are mostly there to confirm government policy, rather than inform it. They'll say whatever they are paid to . . . Scientists can be bought. Cheaply.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Privilege is wasting time and losing brain cells discussing and inventing pronouns, whilst most of the world's population deals with actual problems.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Right now, there are millions of people scrolling through Twitter looking for something to be offended by.
author: Zuby

quoteText: There are literally millions of people who log onto the internet every day just to insult, harass and hate on individuals they've never met.
author: Zuby

quoteText: The most insufferable people are those who are ultra-privileged and comfy, yet they maintain a victim mentality and negative attitude.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Victim mentality is popular because it provides a permanent alibi for personal failings.
author: Zuby

quoteText: A lot of people don't want to fix their problems, because then they can't complain about them.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Pretending to be a good person has become more important than actually being a good person.
author: Zuby

quoteText: Before you build a better mousetrap, it helps to know if there are any mice out there.
author: Mortimer B. Zuckerman

quoteText: This is a test quote with no author... - Anonymous
This is second a test quote with no author... - Anonymous
